6.description: Makes the owner of any vehicle not inspected as required by §§ 31-38-3 or 31-38-4 responsible for any fines or penalties imposed as a result of non-inspection and prohibits any law enforcement officer from citing the operator of said vehicle.

7.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

8.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

10.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

11.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

15.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

17.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

17.description: Provides that any rate increase with respect to electric distribution companies would be no greater than the increase in the Consumer Price Index or 5.5%, whichever is greater, unless there is approval of a higher rate by the general assembly.

18.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

19.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

20.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

22.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

24.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

25.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

26.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
26.title: School Committees And Superintendents
26.description: Requires school committees to provide transportation for any student who resides two (2) or more miles from school.

28.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

29.title: Establishing A Class Size Maximum For Kindergarten Through Grade Two
29.description: 2) (Mandates 20 students per classroom for kindergarten through second grade. Exceptions for emergencies and temporary situations, not to exceed 3 days and mid-year enrollments.

33.description: Creates the "Rhode Island Student Success Act" which would identify those students who are exempt from paying nonresident tuition at public universities, colleges or community colleges.

38.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub B

38.description: Allows a school district to assess or request a voluntary contribution of money from a student or the student's parent or legal guardian to make a donation, in whole or in part, for the cost of district-sponsored field trips, dances, and clubs.

39.description: Requires the development of curriculums/policies/programs relating to the health risks of e-cigarettes.

44.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

116.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

130.title: Relating To Making Revised Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2020
130.description: Relating To Making Revised Appropriations In Support Of Fy 2020

161.description: Exempts state or municipal police officers, firefighters, judges of state court, and members of the Rhode Island general assembly from the requirement of transparent windshields and windows.

163.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
163.title: Judicial Selection
163.description: Requires the judicial nominating commission to consider a nominee's unique background and overall competence in all areas of the practice of law rather than emphasizing trial and courtroom experience in selecting nominees for the judiciary.

164.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
164.title: Courts - Court Administration
164.description: Requires that the selection pool for court appointed receivers be composed of at least ten percent (10%) of receivers who are persons of color.

165.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
165.title: State Police
165.description: Prohibits more than two (2) members of the state police to be from the same family whether by blood, adoption or marriage.

166.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
166.title: State Police--diversity
166.description: Beginning June 30, 2020 requires 2 in 5 recruits to the Rhode Island State Police Training Academy be a person of color and also requires vigorous recruitment effort.

167.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
167.title: Children -- Confinement In Motor Vehicles Prohibited
167.description: Repeals the requirement that law enforcement officers issue only warnings of the risks to persons leaving a child under the age of seven (7) unattended in a motor vehicle.

168.title: Relating To Public Property And Works
168.description: Prohibits any development of land contiguous to the State House unless approved by the general assembly.

169.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
169.title: Use Of Animals In Medical Training
169.description: Prohibits a medical training program from using live animals if another accredited training program in the same medical discipline does not use animals or if an alternative teaching method exists.

170.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
170.title: Lighting Equipment
170.description: Prohibits the replacement of original equipment from manufacturer front light lamps that project a beam of light greater than the intensity of the original lamps.

172.title: Adoption Of Children
172.description: Directs the department of health to provide information regarding the passive voluntary adoption reunion registry on the department of health's website and in the division of vital records.

173.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
173.title: Dry Dock Facilities
173.description: Amends the lien and notice procedures for facility operators of dry dock facilities.

174.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
174.title: Pfas In Drinking Water, Groundwater And Surface Waters
174.description: Department of health to establish maximum PFAS levels in water.

175.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
175.title: Residential Solar Energy-- Disclosure And Homeowners Bill Of Rights Act
175.description: Grants residential purchasers of solar energy systems protections and disclosures in the retail sale/lease documents.

176.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
176.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act -- The Rhode Island Cannabis Equity Act Of 2020
176.description: Directs the department of business regulation to undertake a social equity and race analysis to examine whether racial business disparities exist in the process to obtain a state license.

179.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
179.title: Roofing Contractors
179.description: Amends the registration and licensure requirements of roofing contractors.

180.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
180.title: Public Transit Authority
180.description: Enables the Rhode Island public transit authority (RIPTA) to work with the Massachusetts Bay Transit Authority (MBTA) to allow commuter rail passes to be used as dual passes for both RIPTA and MBTA.

181.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Potters Avenue Realty, Llc
181.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Potters Avenue Realty, Llc

182.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
182.title: Relating To Public Property And Works-minority Business Enterprise
182.description: Provides that any women's business enterprise that is certified under the Federal Small Business Act would be deemed certified by the department of administration as a women's business enterprise.

183.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
183.title: Payment Of Wages
183.description: Eliminates repealed statute references and create a mechanism for employees to enforce their existing right to continuation of medical benefits.

184.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
184.title: Unlawful Employment Practices
184.description: Prohibits an employer, employment agency, labor organization, or employee, to commit any act declared to be an unlawful employment practice; individuals would be held personally liable for such conduct.

185.title: Fair Employment Practices
185.description: Comprehensively addresses wage discrimination by expanding employee protections and the scope of the remedies available to employees who have experienced wage discrimination.

186.title: Relating To Health And Safety
186.description: Requires that the department of health establish an annual online rating system of dementia and Alzheimer care facilities.

187.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
187.title: Physical Therapy Copay
187.description: Limits copays, coinsurance or office deductible for services of a physical therapist to the amount authorized for the services of a primary care physician or osteopath.

188.title: Donation Of Medications For Use By Nonprofit, State And Local Facilities
188.description: Establishes a process for the donation of unused medications for use by nonprofit, state and local facilities by owners of animals.

190.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
190.title: Alzheimer's Disease And Related Disorders Ombudsperson Act Of 2020
190.description: Establishes Alzheimer's disease/related disorders ombudsperson program in DOH to advocate for/assist individuals in coordinating medical/social services care.

191.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
191.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Pedicurists, Manicurists, Or Individual Makeup Application Services
191.description: Allows for a 4 yr training period with a licensed barber, hairdresser, pedicurist, manicurist, or individual providing makeup application services for individuals that presently do not have a license upon completion of 4 yrs training to receive a license.

192.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
192.title: Physical Therapists
192.description: Authorizes physical therapists to order diagnostic imaging (x-rays). Authority sunsets December 31, 2022.

193.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
193.title: Mental Health Law
193.description: Includes licensed advanced practice registered nurses (APRN), certified in psychiatric/mental health, as qualified to certify the need for mental health treatment in certain patients.

194.title: Hearing Aids
194.description: Increases mandatory insurance coverage for hearing aids from $1,500 to $2,000, per ear, every three (3) years. In addition, the amount of insurance coverage would no longer be based on the age of the recipient.

195.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
195.title: The Breast Cancer Act
195.description: Amends the current law so that digital breast tomosynthesis (dbt) screenings are available wherever mammograms are conducted and provides insurance coverage for such screenings.

197.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
197.description: Names Route 4 and Route 1 from Warwick to Westerly The Purple Heart Memorial Highway.

198.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Fred’s Autohaus, Inc.
198.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Fred’s Autohaus, Inc.

199.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
199.title: Conservation And Preservation Restrictions On Real Property
199.description: Requires conservation and preservation restrictions to be liberally interpreted in favor of the grants awarded.

200.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
200.title: Relating To Taxation-historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
200.description: Repeals the sunset provision which ends historic preservation tax credits by June 30, 2020 or upon the exhaustion of the maximum aggregate credits, whichever comes first.

201.title: Motion Picture Production Tax Credits
201.description: Authorizes motion picture tax credits for a production that does not have its primary location within the state, provided a minimum of ten million dollars in state certified production costs are incurred and paid within a twelve (12) month period.

202.title: Relating To Taxation
202.description: Provides tax credit for community service hours to not-for-profit entities/municipal departments certified by dept. Of admin. Up to $500 for individual/$1000 for joint return.

204.title: School Building Authority
204.description: Provides for school construction projects approved after July 1, 2020, that Rhode Island based architectural businesses be used or the project is only eligible to receive five (5) incentive points.

205.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
205.title: Code Of Ethics
205.description: Exempts elected and appointed municipal employees from the prohibition of seeking or holding employment with the municipality they represent.

207.title: The Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
207.description: Directs the Rhode Island Public Transit Authority to alter bus route 58.

208.title: Zoning Ordinances
208.description: Permits Barrington to have three alternate members on zoning board who may participate in hearings and shall vote in the absence of other members. Each member of the board may vote only if they attended all hearings relative to the matter before board.

209.title: Collection Of Taxes Generally
209.description: Permits the town of Barrington to deny issuance or renewal of licenses or permits for properties on which the taxes and/or assessments are in arrears.

211.title: Dog Enforcement And Penalties -- Foster
211.description: Authorizes the Foster town council to enact ordinances permitting the dog officer in the town to issue citations for the violation of dog ordinances.

212.title: Impoundment And Disposition Of Uncollared Dogs -- Foster
212.description: Authorizes the Foster town council to enact an impoundment fee for impounded dogs.

213.title: Passing, Use Of Lanes, And Rules Of The Road
213.description: Provides for specific fines and sanctions to operators of motor vehicles who fail to exercise due care to avoid colliding with a vulnerable road user causing injury, serious injury, or death to the vulnerable road user.

214.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
214.title: Balloons
214.description: Prohibits the release of balloons inflated with lighter-than-air gas subject to $250 fine effective October 1, 2020.

215.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
215.title: Certificate Of Title
215.description: Enables a married couple to have both their names listed as co-owners with right of survivorship on a certificate of title issued by the division of motor vehicles.

218.title: Medical Insurance Coverage For Epinephrine Injectors
218.description: Requires group health plans and health insurance issuers that provide prescription benefits to cover prescribed epinephrine injectors and cartridges. No copayment or deductible would be required to obtain a prescribed epinephrine injector or cartridge.

219.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness -- The Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2020
219.description: Creates the "Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act of 2020," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

221.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
221.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
221.description: Provides that any law or regulation which protects a person from exposure to second hand smoke would also provide protection from exposure to second-hand marijuana smoke, regardless of how the smoke was generated.

223.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
223.title: Division Of Developmental Disabilities
223.description: Requires that adults eligible for services through the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals receive speech and communication support.

224.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
224.title: Rhode Island Early Educator Investment Act
224.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Early Educator Investment Act to develop and implement strategies to improve the compensation of early educators.

225.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
225.description: Limits the application fee for pharmacists to two hundred dollars ($200) annually.

226.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
226.title: Prevention And Suppression Of Contagious Diseases - Hiv/aids
226.description: Permits clinical laboratories as defined in § 23-16.2-2 to conduct its own analysis of specimens for the detection of HIV/AIDS instead of sending the specimens to the department of health.

227.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
227.title: Insurance Consumer Protection Sales Act
227.description: Prohibits person/business entity from conditioning requiring offer for sale/lease of tangible personal property on purchase of ins. From any ins. producer/insurer or releasing consumer's personal identification info eff. 1/1/21.

228.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
228.title: Community Antenna Television Systems
228.description: Prohibits any fees for the replacement/reinstallation/reconnection of a defective or damaged cable box and any replacement/reinstallation/reconnection shall be completed within 48 hours of the subscriber's request.

230.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor
230.title: Responsible Recycling, Reuse And Disposal Of Mattresses
230.description: Requires copies of auditor's documents relative to evaluation and opinion about fees to be filed with the Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation and be considered public records pursuant to chapter 2 of title 38, access to public records.

231.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
231.title: Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
231.description: Increases the number of members of the transit authority from eight to nine and makes the mayor of Providence or designee an ex officio member with voting privileges.

232.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vja Realty, Llc
232.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vja Realty, Llc

233.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
233.title: Net Metering
233.description: Allows new applicants who apply after August 1, 2020, for net-metering systems and community remote-net-metering systems and any person that is a renewable self-generator to increase the maximum mega wattage from 30 MW to megawatts (60 MW).

234.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
234.title: General Provisions
234.description: Provides for the authorized taking of mushrooms from public lands.

239.title: Long-term Health Care Goals And Values--the Rhode Island Alzheimer's Disease Brain Bank Task Force
239.description: Establishes a task force to assess the need, desirability, feasibility and cost of establishing a brain bank for Alzheimer's disease research and other research related to dementia-associated abnormalities of the brain.

240.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
240.title: Kratom Consumer Protection Act
240.description: Regulates the distribution of food products containing the drug kratom, a drug of concern for its stimulant and sedative effects, to consumers by the department of health.

242.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
242.title: Seizure Safe Schools Act
242.description: Requires elementary/secondary schools to have at least 1 school employee trained to administer/assist with the self-administering of seizure rescue medication prescribed to treat seizure disorder systems and the use of prescribed electrical stimulation.

243.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
243.title: Certification Of Teachers
243.description: Creates minority teacher recruitment by allowing the commissioner of education to implement strategies to reach a goal of two hundred (200) minority teachers in the state by 2025.

244.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
244.title: The World Language And Dual Language Immersion Act
244.description: Establishes and requires funding for a world language and dual language immersion program.

245.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
245.title: Condominium Law - Resale Of Units
245.description: Allows a condominium association to impose a fee of up to one hundred twenty-five dollars ($125) for preparation of a resale certificate.

246.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
246.title: Preservation Of Families With Disabled Parent Act
246.description: Precludes a parent's disability from serving as the sole basis for the state to institute an investigation of the disabled parent's family.

247.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
247.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
247.description: Requires returns of a marriage certificate to be filed within two (2) business days after the ceremony, and would validate the common practice of filing the return by mail.

248.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies
248.description: Includes the general assembly elections within the category of elections subject to the risk-limiting audits within the jurisdiction of the board of elections.

249.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
249.title: Committees And Staff
249.description: Requires all individuals testifying before the general assembly or any committee, subcommittee or commission thereof, to be sworn before testifying. Anyone testifying falsely shall be punished pursuant to § 11-33-6.

250.title: Cruelty To Animals
250.description: Prohibits a person convicted of unnecessary cruelty on an animal from owning an animals for 5 years, and a violator of this act is subject to a fine of $1,000.

251.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
251.title: Weight Restrictions
251.description: Prohibits a tractor or truck tractor pulling a trailer or trailers from traveling on Narragansett Parkway between Warwick Ave. and Post Road.

252.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
252.title: Registration Plates, License And Change Of Address
252.description: Authorizes online registration of vehicles sold by a dealership and extends the term of an operator's license from five (5) to ten (10) years.

253.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
253.title: Public Utilities Commission
253.description: Requires all public utilities to maintain a customer service facility within the state to perform services such as addressing customer inquiries and accepting bill payments.

255.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
255.title: Relating To Towns And Cities
255.description: Provides that municipal insurance corporations be subject to laws regulating insurance companies and be regulated by the Rhode Island department of business regulation.

256.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
256.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife
256.description: Prohibits the practice of importing a wild animal into the state, which animal is not native or indigenous to the state, for the purpose of conducting canned hunting.

257.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
257.title: Plastic Waste Reduction Act
257.description: Creates the "Plastic Waste Reduction Act" designed to reduce the use of plastic bags by retail establishments by offering recyclable bag options and providing penalties for violations.

258.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
258.title: Pfas In Food Packaging
258.description: Prohibits PFAS, a class of fluorinated organic chemicals, from being used in food packaging.

259.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
259.title: Artificial Propagation Of Game
259.description: Prohibits captive hunting/possession, sale, breeding, importation of any mammal for purpose of captive hunting.

260.title: The Hospital Conversion Act
260.description: Expands the health services council from twelve (12) to twenty-four (24) members and amends the hospital conversion act relative to disclosure.

261.title: Sales And Use Taxes
261.description: Phases out the tangible tax for businesses over five years, while reimbursing the city, towns, and fire districts 50% of the revenue lost. Provides that each city or town would receive 0.05% of any sales tax revenue generated within said city or town.

262.title: Investment Tax Credit
262.description: Requires a business entity receiving tax incentives from the state of Rhode Island or a local municipality to report their eligibility said tax incentive.

263.title: Liability And Computation -- Lease Payments
263.description: Prohibits the collection of a sales or use tax on that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment representing taxes payable by the lessor on the leased motor vehicle.

264.title: Relating To Education
264.description: Ensures pupils school meals regardless of unpaid meal fees and prevents pupil shaming due to unpaid meal fees.

267.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
267.title: Abuse And Exploitation Of Elders -- Abuse And Isolation Of Elders Or Dependent Adults -- The Peter Falk Criminal Isolation Of Elders Act
267.description: Makes it a felony to isolate an elder or dependent adult and would expand the persons entitled to notice when a guardianship or conservatorship petition is filed in the probate court for dependents or elderly adults.

268.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
268.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Purchase And Sale Of Precious Metals
268.description: Requires a licensed buyer of certain precious metals or articles, tools, and electronics to take a digital photograph of their purchase and upload it to the attorney general's license sales tracking system database.

269.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
269.title: Relating Courts And Civil Procedure - Procedure Generally - Witnesses
269.description: Requires, upon motion by counsel in criminal proceeding, attorney general or lead investigating law enforcement agency to issue subpoena or warrant to social media and internet sites for production of material posted or submitted by potential witness.

270.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
270.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Social Media Censorship Protection Act
270.description: Prohibits certain social media companies from censoring users speech by either removal of the user's speech or using algorithms to prevent the user's speech.

271.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
271.title: Relating Criminal Procedure -- Indictments, Informations And Complaints
271.description: Prohibits prosecutions for violations in this state if violation arises from same facts or acts for which defendant has been acquitted in another jurisdiction, unless there exists new evidence substantially warranting prosecution in this state.

274.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
274.title: First Responders
274.description: Establishes March 17 as an annual day of special observance to honor Rhode Island's first responders.

277.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
277.title: Prompt Payment By Department Of Administration
277.description: Amends the provisions for prompt payment of monies owed by the department of administration to their contractors or subcontractors.

278.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
278.title: Electricians
278.description: Allows 288 hours of trade school training to qualify for the journeyperson "B" electrical exam. Increases the period of indentured apprenticeship with the department of labor and training and a licensed electrician master to 4 years.

279.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
279.title: Military Spouse Licensure
279.description: Provides issuance of occupational licenses for military members and spouses stationed in Rhode Island.

280.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
280.title: Maintenance Of Town Highways--construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
280.description: Allows highway contractors providing construction services to state/municipalities/RITBA to provide insurance coverage solely for vehicles used in rendering those services.

282.title: Proper Management Of Unused Paint
282.description: Requires the department of environmental management to solicit procurement of a representative organization to operate the paint stewardship program every two (2) years.

283.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
283.title: Mental Health Services For All Students
283.description: Directs that services provided by school social workers and certified school psychologists would be included as health care related services eligible for federal Medicaid reimbursement.

285.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/12/2020)
285.title: Harm Reduction Center Advisory Committee And Pilot Program
285.description: Creates a pilot program to prevent drug overdoses through the establishment of harm reduction centers, and requires the director of the department of health to promulgate regulations.

289.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
289.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
289.description: Increases the amount of malt beverages that a manufacturer can sell for offsite consumption from twenty-four 12 oz. And Twenty-four 16 oz. bottles or cans to Fifty-five 12 oz. and forty-one 16 oz. bottles and cans respectively.

290.title: The Rhode Island Works Program
290.description: Adjusts the amount of basic cash assistance provided to families living in deep poverty over a two-year period, and would implement an annual cost of living adjustment so that value of basic cash assistance does not erode in the future.

292.title: Reimbursement 911 Restricted Receipt Account
292.description: Provides that a portion of the first responders surcharge be deposited in a restricted receipt account for purposes of funding the E-911 emergency telephone system.

296.title: Licensing
296.description: Creates new standards for determining whether a state work license applicant's past criminal contacts/convictions should disqualify them from receiving a government-issued license.

297.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
297.title: Three Wheel Vehicles
297.description: Provides that three (3)-wheeled motorcycles be included under the licensing requirements of the department of motor vehicles.

298.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
298.title: Local Planning Board Or Commission
298.description: Requires initial, biennial, and continuing education in land use law and planning for local planning and zoning board members.

299.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
299.title: Administrative Procedures
299.description: Administrative hearings to follow superior court rules of procedure and evidence. Provides for subpoena of witnesses and evidence.

300.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
300.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-search Warrants-electronic Information And Data Privacy Act
300.description: Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain search warrants for electronic information, data, location information and other identifying information of subscribers and customers, except in specified circumstances.

302.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
302.title: Gambling And Lotteries
302.description: Allows social gaming in private residences and in public taverns or private clubs as long as the gambling is incidental to a bona fide social relationship between the participants and no person other than the participants receive anything of value.

303.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
303.title: Contested Pet Ownership
303.description: Creates a legal process by which formerly cohabitating parties could seek from the district court a determination as to ownership of any pet.

304.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
304.title: Biodiesel Heating Oil Act Of 2013
304.description: Changes the title of the Biodiesel Heating Oil Act of 2013 to Biodiesel Products provides significant updates to the act as well as minimum standards for biodiesel.

305.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
305.title: Insurer Receivership Model Act
305.description: Establishes a process for insurers who wish to utilize receivership rather than the other processes of liquidation or rehabilitation.

306.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of New England Racing Fuel, Inc.
306.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of New England Racing Fuel, Inc.

307.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
307.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
307.description: Adds house and senate minority leaders or their designees to E-911 advisory commission.

308.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
308.description: Provides that a safety barrier or safety netting would be erected on the Mount Hope Bridge, the Claiborne Pell Bridge, and the Jamestown Verrazzano Bridge, no later than January 1, 2022.

309.title: Relating To Insurance-accessible Residence Modifications
309.description: Allows health insurance plans to provide coverage for accessible residence modifications determined to be medically necessary.

310.title: Governor's Commission On Disabilities
310.description: Establishes appropriate disability language and allows for the law revision director to replace inappropriate disability language in the general law with appropriate disability language.

311.title: Relating To Health And Safety- Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
311.description: Creates the Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act, to provide a legal mechanism whereby a terminally ill patient may choose to end their life using drugs prescribed by a physician.

312.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
312.title: Sanitation In Food Establishments
312.description: Adds pickles and relish to those foods which are permitted to be manufactured and sold as a farm home food product.

313.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine
313.description: Changes the title of chapter 37.2 of title 5 and throughout, replacing "Oriental medicine" with "Chinese medicine" and allows certified individuals to practice acupuncture and Chinese medicine using Chinese medical diagnostic methods.

314.title: Labor And Payment Of Debts
314.description: Amends the definition of public works so that it would include any public works projects performed for any city or town or quasi-municipal entity and the state and any quasi-state entity.

315.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation -- The Motor Vehicle Sales Tax Equity Act
315.description: Exempts the trade-in values of motorcycles from sales tax and would exempt from state sales tax the trade-in value of any pickup under eight thousand one hundred pounds (8100 lbs.) gross weight.

316.title: Public Corporation Debt Management
316.description: Prohibits the general assembly and any governmental or quasi-governmental entity created by it, from issuing moral obligation bonds not secured by the full faith and credit of the state or revenues.

317.title: Budgeting - Legislative Grants
317.description: Provides that legislative grants would be awarded by senators and representatives in equal prorated shares, one half (1/2) in each chamber.

318.title: Establishing An Office Of Inspector General
318.description: Establishes the office of inspector general as an independent administrative agency charged with the responsibility to investigate, detect, and prevent fraud, waste, abuse, and mismanagement in the expenditure of public funds.

319.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
319.title: Privatization Of Municipal Services
319.description: Creates a review process like the existing state service privatization process, which municipalities must follow whenever they seek to privatize the yearly furnishing of municipal services in excess of one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000).

320.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
320.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
320.description: Allows a local review board of a city or town to provide reasonable conditions and limitations on any project. Economic feasibility would not be an impediment to the imposition of such conditions and limitations.

321.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
321.title: Relating To The Central Coventry Fire District
321.description: Amends the procedure for holding annual meeting, special meetings, election, recall and duties of the board of directors and officers, as well as the duties of the tax assessor, district clerk, finance director-treasurer and tax collector.

322.title: Registration Of Vehicles--emergency Management Director Emeritus
322.description: Creates an emergency management director emeritus license plate for Thomas F. Senerchia of West Warwick.

323.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
323.title: Nontransparent Windshields And Windows
323.description: Provides an exemption, for private detectives and private security guards, from the law banning nontransparent windshields and windows.

325.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
325.description: Expands the definition of "employee" to add any individual employed in a food service establishment, which would include a caterer licensed by the department of health and division of taxation, and a food truck.

326.title: Interstate Compact To Award Prizes For Curing Diseases
326.description: Adopts the interstate compact to award prizes for curing diseases.

327.title: Nurse Licensure Compact
327.description: Amends the nurse licensure compact and adopts an enhanced version of the act, to allow nurses to hold a multi-state license which would allow them to practice across state lines without having to obtain multiple licenses.

329.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
329.title: Licensing Of Swimming Pools
329.description: Removes the requirement to have a person trained in first aid in close proximity to operate a swimming pool without a lifeguard.

330.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
330.description: Excludes chronic intractable pain from the definition of acute pain management. Prescribes new guidelines for treatment based upon 2016 CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain.

331.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
331.title: Resilient Rhode Island Act Of 2014 - Climate Change Coordinating Council
331.description: Establishes a statewide greenhouse gas emission reduction mandate.

332.title: The Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
332.description: Establishes the RI Early Childhood Innovation Act and authorizes department of human services to fund programs for at-risk kindergarten children of $1,000,000 annually.

334.title: Payment Of Statutory Fees
334.description: Facilitates state departments/agencies to implement electronic filing of applications for licenses/permits/ registrations/certificates by allowing state vendor to withhold commission for developing and implementing electronic filing web-based system.

335.title: Active Members In Reserves--educational Benefits
335.description: Expands educational benefits to active reservists in the armed forces.

339.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
339.description: Requires state to reimburse the city/town for any costs associated with transporting children placed in foster care by RI-licensed child-placing agency or RI governmental agency to an educational facility outside the regional transportation district.

340.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
340.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes
340.description: Authorizes tax assessors in the cities and towns to use the last statutory update or revaluation as the assessed valuation upon which to levy taxes regarding their real property.

342.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
342.title: Relating To Public Records
342.description: Exempts municipalities from releasing information as to the residency of police officers regarding public records requests.

343.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
343.description: Requires all candidates for office to file the same number of campaign finance reports, all due at the same times, whether or not they have contested primary elections.

344.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
344.title: Size, Weight, And Load Limits
344.description: Amends vehicle size/weight/load limit act by allowing Rhode Island nonprofit corporations to operate oversized vehicles on holidays and weekends in order to participate in parades and other civic, patriotic, historic and educational events and displays.

346.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
346.title: New Home Buyers Fire Protection Act
346.description: Mandates builders of new 1 and 2 family dwellings to provide written info to buyer about installation of automatic sprinkler system subject to civil penalties for violations/results of radon tests/certification of working smoke detector devices eff 1/1/21

347.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
347.title: Property Tax Relief
347.description: Amends the definition of "disabled", for the purposes of property tax relief, to include veterans who earn less than thirty thousand dollars ($30,000) annually and who receive disability benefits.

348.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
348.title: Pesticide Control
348.description: Prohibits the use of neonicotinoids which are a class of insecticides.

349.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/05/2020)
349.title: Rhode Island Energy Resources Act
349.description: Provides for the establishment of comprehensive solar energy siting ordinances in each municipality of the state. The act would also allow the installation of master-meters in housing developments.

350.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
350.title: Employment Of Women And Children
350.description: Requires children who seek a special limited work permit to successfully complete a training program to include workers' rights, workplace health and safety, and workers' compensation, established and funded by DLT.

351.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
351.title: Child Support Intercept Act
351.description: Expands child support interception of insurance payments to include life insurance proceeds payable to non-custodial parents who are the beneficiaries of the policy.

352.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
352.title: Divorce Proceedings - Support For Children
352.description: Eliminates any award of interest by the family court in any enforcement proceeding resulting in a judgment or order for failure to make child support payments.

353.title: Primary Election Dates
353.description: Requires that the primary election date, typically the eighth Tuesday preceding the biennial state elections, shall be held on the Wednesday immediately following Labor Day, only if the eighth Tuesday immediately follows Labor Day.

354.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
354.title: Proceedings In Family Court
354.description: Prohibits any questioning of a juvenile who is suspected of delinquent or criminal behavior, unless the parent of guardian of the juvenile is present, or unless an attorney is present or the juvenile and their parents have waived their presence.

356.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
356.title: School Bus Speed Limits
356.description: Establishes a speed limit for school buses being driven on a limited access highway to ten (10) miles per hour less than the posted speed limit.

357.title: Procedure Generally - Fees
357.description: Provides for a fee increase for filing an action in district court, superior court and family court.

360.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
360.description: Extends the reimbursement to a school district or municipality for the employment of newly hired school resource officers only.

365.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/11/2020)
365.title: Establishment Of Charter Public Schools
365.description: Creates a moratorium on the creation of any new charter public schools until there is a revision in the school funding formula to better reflect ELL and special education services.

366.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
366.title: Rights And Duties Of Teachers Generally
366.description: Broadens the definition of "teacher" and create a comprehensive bill of rights for school teachers.

367.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
367.title: Procedure Generally -- Causes Of Action
367.description: Exempts certain independent third-party contractors for right to privacy violations of appropriation of individual's name/portrait/picture/likeness pursuant to contract upon request of contracting party.

368.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
368.title: Certificates Of Title And Security Interests
368.description: Authorizes the Exeter town sergeant or designees to conduct division of motor vehicles vehicle identifying number and odometer inspections.

369.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
369.title: Genetic Counselors Licensing Act
369.description: Provides a statutory framework for the licensing and regulation of genetic counselors.

370.title: Condominium Law
370.description: Provides that in the town of Cumberland, the maximum height allowed for a commercial or residential condominium complex would be no more than thirty-five feet (35').

371.title: Cancer Benefits For Firefighters
371.description: Clarifies a presumption applying to firefighters that if any type of cancer is found in a firefighter with three (3) exceptions would be conclusively presumed to be an occupational cancer arising out of their employment.

377.title: School Funds And Property
377.description: Establishes a pilot program to promote the creation of roof solar installations on school property in order to reduce the use of fossil fuels and to generate electricity in school buildings.

379.title: Establishing Rhode Island Secure Choice Retirement Savings Trust Act
379.description: Creates investment board/public corporation for management of private employee retirement investments.

380.title: Appellate Tax Board
380.description: Establishes a 5 member appellate tax board to review municipal decisions relating to valuation/assessment/taxation of real/tangible personal property and establishes municipal uniform tax rates for all classes of real/tangible personal property.

381.title: State Funds
381.description: Adds the Judiciary's Indirect Cost Recovery/Supreme Court, Victims' Rights Information, RI Supreme Court Disciplinary Counsel and Small Claims Mediation accounts to the list of restricted receipt accounts which are not subject to indirect cost recovery.

382.title: Courts - District Court
382.description: Creates within the district court a dedicated calendar offering treatment and sentencing alternatives to eligible defendants deemed to suffer from serious and persistent mental illness to be known as the "Mental Health Treatment Calendar".

383.title: Office Of Library And Information Services -- State Aid To Libraries
383.description: Amends various sections relating to libraries to delete outdated provisions, updates language to reflect current practices affecting library technology and increases from 2 years to 5 years the award of the statewide reference resource center contract.

384.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
384.title: Minimum Wage--gratuities
384.description: Raises the minimum wage for tipped workers by fifty cents ($.50) per year commencing on January 1, 2021 until the tipped minimum wage is not less than two-thirds (2/3) of the regular minimum wage.

385.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
385.title: Tip Protection
385.description: Prohibits employers from receiving any portion of the tips given by customers to their tipped employees, with limited exceptions for credit card service charges.

386.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
386.title: Restroom Access Act
386.description: Requires retail establishments with 3 or more employees on the premises without accessible public restroom to allow customers suffering from eligible conditions access to their employee restrooms.

387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
387.title: Healthy Beverage Act
387.description: Creates the "Healthy Beverage Act" which requires that children's meals offered by restaurants include certain healthy beverage options if beverage is automatically included in the meal.

388.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities -- Sepsis Screening Protocols
388.description: Requires licensed health care facility medical staff to adopt, implement, and periodically update evidence-based protocols for the early recognition and treatment of patients with sepsis, severe sepsis and septic shock.

390.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
390.title: Freeways
390.description: Eliminates the provision a person who solicits a ride in a motor vehicle or backs up a motor vehicle on a freeway is guilty of a misdemeanor. Adds $100 fine for advertising a motor vehicle for sale on a state highway to the schedule of violations.

391.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
391.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
391.description: Provides that financial security is required for any motor vehicle registered or required to be registered in the state of Rhode Island.

393.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
393.title: Hotels
393.description: Authorizes an innkeeper to remove any guest who is a level III high risk to reoffend sexual offender who attempts to remain a hotel resident for more than thirty (30) consecutive days in any calendar year.

394.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
394.title: Sexual Assault
394.description: Establishes criteria for the criminal offense of sexual assault when the victim is in the custody of a peace officer. Provides that a person convicted of custodial sexual assault would face imprisonment for not more than 3 years.

395.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
395.title: Adjudication Of Traffic Offenses
395.description: Removes the $25.00 limit on tuition for a motorist to attend a driver education course, and would allow a judge or magistrate to delay the imposition of a suspension or revocation of a driver's license or registration for a period up to 30 days.

396.title: Primary Elections
396.description: Provides that in the event a primary election is held on a day following a holiday then the primary shall be held on the next business day.

398.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies--mandatory Use Of Paper Ballots
398.description: Requires that all local, state and federal voting be conducted through the use of paper ballots.

399.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
399.title: Animal Fur Products
399.description: Prohibits the sale of fur products in the state of Rhode Island.

401.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rita's Pizza, Inc.
401.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Rita's Pizza, Inc.

403.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
403.title: State Emblems
403.description: Designates "Northern Star Coral" as the official state coral.

404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
404.title: Ordinances
404.description: Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances restricting vaping in public places and areas near schools, day care and hospitals.

405.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Genesis Systems, Inc.
405.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Genesis Systems, Inc.

406.title: Rhode Island Business Corporation Act
406.description: Imposes a fee of one hundred sixty dollars ($160) for all domestic and foreign corporations for a certificate of authority to transact business in this state.

409.title: Medical Assistance
409.description: Directs EOHHS to implement process for determining fees/reimbursement rates for non-emergency medical transportation service/sets $147 fee per trip/$1.50 per mile/certificate of need required after 7/1/20.

412.title: Sidewalks
412.description: Requires all maintenance of state highways to be the responsibility of the state.

413.title: State Tax Officials - Sales And Use Taxes -- Enforcement And Collection
413.description: Allows any tax payments to be paid by midnight of the date the tax is due and also provides for a twenty-four (24) hour extension of time to pay the tax.

414.title: Student Loan Tax Credit
414.description: Allows for a tax credit up to one thousand dollars ($1,000) for any resident of the state that is obligated for a student loan, who is attending a college, university, or other post-secondary school in the state, and working within the state.

416.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation
416.description: Adds prayer cards and other items customarily sold or provided by a funeral director to those funeral items which are already exempt from sales and use taxes.

417.title: Small Estates
417.description: Increases the value of a small estate from fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000) to twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000).

418.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies -- Step Therapy Protocols
418.description: Requires health insurers that issue prescription drug coverage to use step therapy protocols.

420.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
420.title: School Waste Recycling And Refuse Disposal
420.description: Requires schools to comply with recycling and composting laws and promotes the donation of unspoiled nonperishable food by schools. Requires the use of share tables at all schools.

422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
422.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
422.description: Establishes student privacy in take-home technology.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Responsibility Of Owners Of Rental Vehicles
424.description: Provides that violations of chapter 34 of title 31 pertaining to rental vehicles are civil violations subject to the jurisdiction of the Rhode Island traffic tribunal.

425.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
425.title: Department Of Children, Youth And Families
425.description: Provides 5 year term for DCYF director. Governor with advice and consent of the Senate can remove director of DCYF at any time.

426.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
426.title: Courts -- Court Administration
426.description: Invests the chief justice of the supreme court with the explicit authority to address issues affecting the conduct of judicial business and order whatever response(s) he or she deems necessary.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Law Practice
427.description: Provides that the rules and unauthorized practice of law committee would be approved and promulgated by the supreme court.

429.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
429.title: Superior Court
429.description: Changes the name of the drug court magistrate to the "Rhode Island superior court adult drug/recovery court magistrate and changes the name of the court to the "Rhode Island superior court adult drug/recovery court".

432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
432.title: Procedure In Particular Actions -- Attachment
432.description: Provides that child support garnishment be paid first before any other garnishment including a garnishment for the payment of taxes.

434.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
434.title: Enabling The State Lottery Division Of The Department Of Revenue To Contract With Igt Global Solutions Corporation And Twin River
434.description: Enables the state lottery division of the department of revenue to enter into a contract extension with IGT Global Solutions Corporation and contract extensions with Twin River and affiliates of Twin River.

435.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
435.title: Department Of Public Safety--school Safety Emergency Communications System
435.description: Requires the department of public safety to procure, subject to appropriation, an interoperable school safety emergency communications system that facilitates emergency response activities in the state.

436.title: Wholesale Prescription Drug Importation Program
436.description: Establishes a program for the importation of wholesale prescription drugs from Canada to provide cost savings to Rhode Island consumers.

437.title: Prescriptions
437.description: Limits health insurance carriers that provide coverage for prescription insulin drugs used to treat diabetes to fifty ($50) dollars copayment for a thirty (30) day supply of medically necessary insulin.

439.title: Pharmacies--prescriptions
439.description: Requires pharmacists to notify their customers whether their cost sharing benefits exceed the actual retail price of the prescription sought, in the absence of prescription drug coverage.

441.title: Physician Assistants
441.description: Expands the rights of physician assistants with regard to their practice and prohibits non-compete clauses that exceed five years with regard to the purchase and sale of a practice.

442.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
442.title: State Tax Officials
442.description: Requires electronic filing of returns and remittance of payments for certain larger business registrants.

444.title: State Tax Officials -- Sales And Use Taxes -- Enforcement And Collection
444.description: Provides that a tax payment shall be paid by midnight on the date in which the tax becomes due and payable, and reduces the amount of penalty for taxes unpaid from a maximum of twenty-one percent (21%) to ten percent (10%).

445.title: 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act -- Prepaid Wireless E-911 Charge Act
445.description: Eliminates first responder surcharges from the 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act.

446.title: Hemp Growth Act
446.description: Repeals the licensure fee for a hemp license and reduce the license application fee from two hundred fifty dollars ($250) to one hundred dollars ($100).

448.title: Independent Military Organizations
448.description: Eliminates the $2,500 appropriation for the naval militia battalion in their armory afloat, the U.S.S. Providence, and makes an annual appropriation in the amount of $2,500 to the Kingston Reds in the town of Coventry for the rental of an armory.

451.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
451.title: Courts
451.description: Places the jurisdiction of minors in the family court when it comes to matters involving protective orders of domestic assault.

452.title: Uniform Law On Paternity -- Uniform Parentage Act
452.description: Repeals current state law regarding paternity and replaces it with a uniform parentage act that provides procedures establishing parentage, genetic testing, surrogacy agreements and assisted reproduction.

453.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
453.title: Right-of-way
453.description: Makes it a traffic offense for a motorist to fail to yield the right-of-way when leaving a public roadway to enter or cross a private road or driveway.

454.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
454.title: Disorderly Conduct - Protective Equipment And Disguised Masks Prohibited
454.description: Makes it a misdemeanor for persons to carry, possess, or wear masks or protective clothing or equipment designed to minimize the risk of injury from deadly weapons, for the purposes of hindering law enforcement crowd control actions.

455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
455.title: Correctional Institutions
455.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
459.title: Taxi Cabs And Limited Public Motor Vehicles
459.description: Requires national and state background checks for certain drivers transporting passengers for hire.

460.title: Hotels--human Trafficking Reporting And Prevention Act
460.description: Creates the Human Trafficking Reporting and Prevention Act applicable to hotels requiring them to educate their employees about identifying, reporting and preventing human trafficking on their premises.

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
461.title: Size, Weight And Load Limits
461.description: Authorizes the department of transportation to impose a weight restriction or close any state, local or privately-owned bridge, in the interest of public safety.

462.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
462.title: Internet Service Providers - Net Neutrality
462.description: Requires Internet service providers to follow Internet service neutrality requirements.

464.title: Relating To An Amendment Of And In Addition To Entitled "to Incorporate The First Hopkinton Cemetery Association," Passed At The January Session, A.d. 1880, As Amended
464.description: Amends the corporate charter of The First Hopkinton Cemetery Association passed at the January session A.D. 1880, as amended.

466.title: Class A Liquor Licenses
466.description: Authorizes the town of Smithfield to issue a total of five (5) Class A liquor store licenses.

468.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
468.description: Limits beneficiary's out-of-pocket expenditures for prescription drugs to limits established for self-only and family coverage per year established in the Internal Revenue Code. Effective January 1, 2021.

470.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
470.title: Hoisting Engineers
470.description: Exempts non-commercial operators of motorized trucks and equipment from the requirements of the hoisting engineers' chapter, if they own, in whole or in part, the land upon which they are working.

471.title: Exemptions From Licensing
471.description: Raises the maximum check cashing fee from fifty cents ($.50) to six dollars ($6.00) per check, for persons cashing checks in instances where cashing checks is incidental to the retail sale of goods or services.

472.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act
472.description: Raises appraisal threshold amount for unfair practices re: auto insurance from $2500 $5000, requires insurance company to complete appraisal within four days, redefines fair market value to include compilations commonly used by the insurance industry.

473.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
473.title: State Building Code -- Administration And Enforcement
473.description: Eliminates provisions establishing a legislative regulation committee, and would also repeal the provision that codes and standards adopted by the state building code standards committee subject to approval by the legislative regulation committee.

474.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
474.title: Wages
474.description: Increases the minimum wage by using an annual fixed amount until January 1, 2024, where it reaches to fifteen dollars ($15.00) per hour, then raised annually thereafter by using the (CPI-W). It also raises the cash wage by using a similar scale.

476.title: Dentists And Dental Hygienists
476.description: Requires at least one oral and maxillofacial surgeon on the Rhode Island board of examiners in dentistry.

477.title: Assisted Living Residences
477.description: Requires department of health to establish an informal dispute resolution to address any changes to department of health violations.

479.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
479.title: The Civic Literacy Act
479.description: Requires the implementation of the civic literacy act for all students between the eighth and twelfth grades.

480.title: Long-term Care Ombudsperson Act Of 1995
480.description: Requires informed consent of the elderly for referral of investigations to be made by other state agencies by the long-term care ombudsperson (LTCO).

481.title: Drug Cost Transparency
481.description: Provides drug cost transparency by requiring reports be submitted by drug manufacturers, pharmacy benefit managers and health benefit plan insurers to the director of the department of business regulation regarding drug prices and increases the prices.

482.title: Equipment And Accessories Generally
482.description: Requires school buses to be equipped with a crossing control arm in addition to a stop arm commencing September 1, 2021.

484.title: Department Of Attorney General
484.description: Authorizes the department of attorney general to receive 30% of any settlement resulting from a multi-state initiative with any balance over $1,500,000 at the end of a fiscal year transferred to the general fund.

486.title: Child Care - State Subsidies
486.description: Creates the reimbursement rates to be paid by the department of human services and the department of children, youth and families for licensed child care centers/family child care homes which would be tiered to promote quality improvements in child care

487.title: Wine Direct Shipper License
487.description: Creates a wine direct license for licensed producers to directly ship limited wine to residents of RI over age twenty one (21).

489.title: Medical Assistance -- Perinatal Doula Services
489.description: Provides for medical assistance health care for expectant mothers and would establish medical assistance coverage and reimbursement rates for perinatal doula services.

490.title: Beer And Malt Beverage Exemption
490.description: Exempts beer and malt beverage from sales tax.

491.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
491.title: Special Police For Private Institutions
491.description: Clarifies the jurisdiction of special police officers upon the land and buildings of educational institutions, and on roads adjacent to the educational institutions to instances where the officer notices that a person is in danger of bodily harm.

494.title: Parole
494.description: Makes minors who were sentenced as adults, eligible for parole after serving fifteen years of sentence. Applies to those serving life without parole and would apply to those prisoners whose offenses were committed after January 1, 1991.

495.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
495.title: Traffic Tribunal
495.description: Vests the traffic tribunal with jurisdiction over the adjudication of alleged violations of the harassment of hunters, trappers and fishers law.

496.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/11/2020)
496.title: Fair Housing Practices
496.description: Prohibits discrimination in housing against those persons who have a lawful source of income.

498.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
498.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
498.description: Provides for the sealing and unsealing of court files in residential eviction proceedings.

504.title: State Building Code
504.description: Requires any single-user toilet facility in a public building or place of public accommodation that exists or is constructed on or after July 1, 2020, be available to persons of any gender.

505.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
505.title: Securing The Financial Future For All Students Act
505.description: Provides that the council on elementary and secondary education be encouraged to maintain, publish and update statewide standards for instruction of personal finance in public high schools.

506.title: The Animal Welfare Advisory Council
506.description: Establishes an animal welfare advisory council to advise the governor and the general assembly on matters relating to animal welfare, treatment, health, and safety of companion animals.

507.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/11/2020)
507.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils -- Trauma Informed Schools Act
507.description: Establishes the implementation of trauma-informed practices in schools throughout the state.

508.title: Newborn Screening Program
508.description: Mandates rules and regulations of department of health for newborn test to include disorders and conditions in federal recommended uniform screening.

510.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
510.title: Beverage Container Deposit Recycling Act Of 2020
510.description: Creates a refundable five cent ($0.05) deposit for non-reusable beverage containers. A one cent ($0.01) handling fee would be paid by distributors.

511.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/05/2020)
511.title: Coastal Resources Management Council
511.description: Provides that the authority of the CRMC shall include specific areas designated in "special area management plans" (SAMP).

514.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/12/2020)
514.title: Rhode Island Community Resiliency And Preservation Act
514.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Community Resiliency and Preservation Act to provide cities and towns with the authority to propose, for consideration and decision by their voters, a reliable source of capital funding for investing in their community.

516.title: Retirement System - Contributions And Benefits
516.description: Awards all pension system members 3% COLA applied to first $30,000 of retirement allowance annually exp. 1/1/21 provided prior year investment return gains 10% or more until fund is 80% funded.

517.title: Equality In Abortion Coverage
517.description: Provides for abortion coverage in the Medicaid program and repeal the abortion coverage exclusion for state employee insurance plans.

518.title: The Uniformed Controlled Substances Act
518.description: Expands drug awareness programs to high schools, directs funding from certain civil fines and mandates establishment of criteria for funding.

520.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
520.description: Creates hardship designation for patients on SSDI, Medicaid, establishes discount medicine program, eliminates plant tagging, allows unlimited compassion center licenses, redefines debilitating condition, reduces compassion center license fee to $5,000.

521.title: Bus Lane Travel Fine
521.description: Creates a new traffic offense, with a fine, for traveling in a bus lane.

523.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
523.title: Nursing Home Staffing And Quality Care Act
523.description: Mandates minimum staffing levels/standards for quality care for nursing homes with penalties for violations/grants for enhanced training/wages adjusted for inflation.

524.title: Electronic Payment Of Sales Taxes
524.description: Requires that the tax administrator credit electronic sales and use tax payments made electronically exactly when submitted.

526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
526.title: Deceptive Trade Practices
526.description: Amends the deceptive trade practices chapter to clarify the law's exemptions and enhances the attorney general's authority to seek civil penalties for violations of the law.

527.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
527.title: Department Of Transportation
527.description: Requires the DOT to establish a schedule of all maintenance, including landscaping and mowing of lawns on state roads, and provide a copy of said schedule to the department of public works in any city or town where the state road is located.

528.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
528.title: Subdivision Of Land - Zoning Ordinances
528.description: Provides planning board approval votes require majority of members present at time of vote/quorum of zoning review board would authorize voting members including alternates. Effective January 1, 2021 prospective only.

530.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
530.title: Emergency Police Power
530.description: Permits all Rhode Island police departments including police departments of higher education institutions to enter into non-emergency mutual aid agreements regardless of any geographical boundary.

537.title: Eligibility To Vote
537.description: Allows individuals, who have not reached the age of eighteen (18) years, to vote in a primary election, as long as the voter will be eighteen (18) as of the date of the general or special election.

538.title: Grand Juries
538.description: Permits grand juries to issue reports and would provide for a process for review and acceptance by the superior court. No reports would be issued after July 1, 2025.

542.title: The Hospital Conversions Act
542.description: Amends the Hospital Conversion Act to add the transaction's compliance with the Rhode Island Antitrust Act to the list of criteria for review by the Attorney General.

543.title: Teachers' Retirement
543.description: Allows teachers, state and municipal employees eligible to retire upon the earlier of reaching age sixty (60) with thirty (30) years of service or the employee's retirement eligibility date under present state statutes, commencing July 1, 2020.

544.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
544.title: Tourism And Development
544.description: Applies the hotel tax distribution formula for entities within the Providence regional tourism district to any and all hotels physically connected to the Rhode Island Convention Center.

546.title: Senior Center Building Capital Fund
546.description: Creates senior center building capital fund to provide cities and towns with financial assistance up to thirty percent of the construction cost of the project.

548.title: Manufacturing And Economic Development--tax Incentives
548.description: Establishes the "refundable investment tax credit act" to provide for a refundable investment tax credit for certain investments in the construction of facilities, acquisition of tangible property, and the training of employees in the state.

551.title: Temporary Disability Insurance--general Provisions
551.description: Increases taxable wage base for TDI/TCI contributions/coverage/maximum weeks for TC leave/provides fines/penalties for non-reinstatement of employee/creates tax credit for low wage employees.

552.title: Department Of Human Services
552.description: Raises Medicaid primary care payment rates to federal Medicare levels.

561.title: Business Corporation Tax
561.description: Exempts a corporation from payment of the minimum tax imposed by § 44-11-2(e) during the first year of the corporation's existence.

562.title: Business Corporation Tax And Franchise Tax
562.description: Lowers the minimum corporate tax imposed from four hundred dollars ($400) to three hundred seventy-five dollars ($375).

563.title: Video-lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering
563.description: Increases the annual flat fee given to Lincoln and Tiverton by their respective sports wagering facilities to two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000).

564.title: The Educational Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
564.description: Requires the state to make a one-time appropriation to all school districts who had their state educational aid reduced for the 2019-2020 fiscal year, as compared to their 2018-2019 fiscal year aid, to make up for that reduction in state aid.

565.title: Preceptors Tax Credit Act
565.description: Allows for a tax credit of five hundred dollars ($500) for any nurse practitioner or physician who provide on-site clinical education as a preceptor clinician to nurse practitioner graduate students, enrolled in the graduate nursing program.

567.title: Categorical Programs, State Funded Expenses
567.description: Provides for an appropriation in the amount of $2,000,000 to the various school districts and municipalities to employ additional school resource officers, as reimbursement for 1/2 of the salary of the officers, based upon student enrollment.

568.title: Department Of Administration
568.description: Defines light duty, non-emergency and zero emission vehicles and requires the state to convert its fleet of vehicles to no less than fifty percent (50%) of vehicles in those categories by the year 2028.

570.title: Tobacco And Nicotine Products--children
570.description: Provides certain restrictions on the sale of tobacco products, enhance the definition of "tobacco products", and raises the minimum age to purchase tobacco products and nicotine-delivery systems from eighteen (18) to twenty-one (21) years of age.

571.title: Relating To The General Assembly
571.description: Amends the membership, classification of service of employees and meeting regulations for the joint committee on legislative services.

572.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Program
