572.description: Repeals the “Rhode Island Health Care Reform Act of 2004 – Health Insurance Oversight” and the “Rhode Island Health Benefit Exchange.” Establishes a universal, comprehensive, affordable single-payer health care insurance program to cut health care costs.

573.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-the Rhode Island Cannabis Equity Act
573.description: Establishes a board and appropriates funds from the legislature to create a local cannabis equity program to allow those people who want to enter the business of selling marijuana with state funding and technical assistance to do so.

575.title: Department Of Administration--state Construction Projects Metrics
575.description: Requires that the division of planning create a checklist of environmental and energy issues that certain state construction projects which cost in excess of $10,000,000 would need to consider and address.

577.title: Rhode Island Pathways Project
577.description: Requires the executive office of health and human services (EOHHS) to conduct a study to assess the impact of using Medicaid funds to provide coverage for the treatment of the chronically homeless.

578.title: Retirement System--contributions And Benefits
578.description: Requires the yearly state contribution to the pension system not be reduced until the fund ratio meets or exceeds eighty percent (80%).

579.title: Rhode Island Department Of Children, Youth And Families Scholarship Program
579.description: Provides that a student in the care and custody of the department of children, youth and families may attend Rhode Island College without the payment of tuition as long as they meet admission criteria of Rhode Island College.

580.title: Audio And Video Recordings
580.description: Requires audio and video recordings of certain open meetings of municipal government to be transmitted to the secretary of state's office.

583.title: Tax Credits For Contributions To Scholarship Organizations
583.description: Increases the total aggregate amount of tax credits for contributions to scholarship organizations by a business entity meeting the requisite criteria to five million dollars in fiscal year 2021 and includes definition for an "eligible business entity".

584.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes
584.description: Repeals the estate tax and transfer tax.

588.title: Deferred Compensation Plans
588.description: Allows state employees the ability to make an after tax contribution to a qualified Roth contribution program as a part of a deferred compensation plan.

590.title: The Medical Professional Scholarship Program
590.description: Establishes medical professional scholarship program to award $5,000 scholarships for four (4) years of college tuition to eligible applicants selected by commissioner funded by a $25 assessment on medical professionals.

591.title: State Lottery
591.description: Creates an instant ticket scratch off game pilot program to raise funds for Rhode Island veterans and dependents of qualified service members. Expires on December 31, 2021.

592.title: Acquisition Of Land
592.description: Increases the threshold for general assembly approval on state leases from five years and aggregate rent exceeding five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) to five years and an aggregate rent exceeding five million dollars ($5,000,000).

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Criminal Injuries Compensation
594.description: Permits the release of records relating to criminal injuries compensation by allowing for limited disclosure to be permitted personable and government officials.

596.title: The Joint Tortfeasor Act
596.description: Allows a release by the injured person of one joint tortfeasor to relieve that tortfeasor from liability to make contribution to another joint tortfeasor.

597.title: Uniform Directed Trust Act
597.description: Permits the settlor of a trust to designate a trust director who shall be a person other than the trustee to direct actions relative to a trust and pursuant to any power of direction.

599.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses
599.description: Allows the department of motor vehicles to issue driving privilege licenses and permits to applicants unable to establish lawful presence in the United States.

601.title: Correctional Institutions -- Parole
601.description: Provides that for parole violations that don't involve a new criminal offense, the right to a final parole revocation hearing not involving new criminal offenses may be waived if the violator admits to the violation and accepts the sanctions imposed.

606.title: Social Host Regulations
606.description: Authorizes the imposition of civil and criminal penalties against any person(s) who purchase, furnish, procure marijuana or permit marijuana to be used by others.

608.title: Campaign Finance -- Forfeiture Of Contributions
608.description: Creates a statutory scheme to better enforce campaign finance reporting laws for criminal convictions for campaign contributions embezzlement or violations.

609.title: Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates
609.description: Requires candidates seeking to be elected by write-in ballot to file a declaration of intent, prior to the election, of a write-in candidacy.

610.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Establishing The "consumer Personal Data Protection Act Of 2020"
610.description: Regulates data brokers. Data brokers would be required to annually register; to provide substantive notifications to consumers; and to adopt comprehensive data security programs.

611.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Establishing The Student Cloud Computing Privacy And Protection Act
611.description: Establishes the "student cloud computing privacy and protection act".

613.title: Sexual Assaults
613.description: Defines any act of sexual penetration or contact perpetrated by an individual with a position of authority upon a person over the age of fourteen (14) and under the age of eighteen (18) as third degree sexual assault.

614.title: Courts -- Family Court
614.description: Only protective orders issued against adults are to be transmitted to A.G.'s B.C.I. for inclusion in the R.O.N.C.O. system. Protective orders against juveniles will be accessible to law enforcement.

615.title: Electronic Vehicle Recovery Services
615.description: Creates a vehicle recovery service requiring vehicle owners to submit an affidavit of theft of vehicle prior to law enforcement contacting service provider to locate vehicle.

616.title: Rhode Island Uniform Real Property Transfer On Death Act
616.description: Allows an owner or owners of real property to execute a deed that names one or more beneficiaries who will obtain title to the property at the owner's death without the necessity of probate.

617.title: Animal Abuser Registry Act
617.description: Creates the "animal abuser registry act" which would require all persons convicted of felonies involving animal abuse to register with an online registry to be established and maintained by the department of public safety.

620.title: Highway Safety Act
620.description: Amend several chapters regarding the operation of bikes on state highways and interaction with motor vehicles, aggressive honking, regulation of E-bikes, reckless driver accountability program & speed limits in thickly settled areas/business districts.

621.title: Canvassing The Lists Of Qualified Electors
621.description: Requires that inactive voters and mail ballot voters be indicated on the e-pollbooks.

622.title: State Archives
622.description: Creates a definition for permanent records and would provide for their administration by the state archivist.

628.title: Sentence And Execution -- Hate Crimes Sentencing Act
628.description: Amends the definition of hate crime in various portions of the criminal law and provides that perpetrators may be prosecuted for hate crimes when they are motivated in part by perceptions or beliefs regarding those in protected groups.

631.title: Public Records Administration
631.description: Establishes public records administration program for the custody/disposal of state public records assisted by an advisory commission.

632.title: Commercial Sexual Activity
632.description: Provides for criminal penalties for permitting commercial sexual activity and allows for the use of wire taps in instances of human trafficking and where commercial sexual activity is permitted on a premises.

635.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance - Mandatory Arbitration Provision
635.description: Allows a party subjected to the mandatory arbitration provision pursuant to motor vehicle insurance may provide notice of his or her reservation of rights to a jury trial by email, delivery receipt requested requested.

637.title: State Aid
637.description: Requires payment in lieu of taxes on any state owned real estate property located in Exeter. Said payments would be applied to the creation of an Exeter police department, which would then be required to provide municipal services to the state.

640.title: Pen Registers And Trap And Trace Devices
640.description: Prohibits the use of a stingray cell-site simulator device by any law enforcement agency except upon application for its use and the granting of its order by the presiding justice of the superior court.

641.title: Trespass And Vandalism
641.description: Provides that no person be prosecuted for fishing, gathering seaweed, swimming or passage along the sandy or rocky shoreline within ten feet (10') of the most recent high tide line.

643.title: Organization Of The General Assembly
643.description: Allows members of the general assembly to cast votes by telephone or video conference whenever the governor declares a state of emergency.

649.title: Mail Ballots -- Early Voting
649.description: Authorizes early voting for registered and eligible electors, in all elections for the twenty (20) days before an election at designated city and town locations, with advance public notice regulated by rules promulgated by the state board of elections.

652.title: Claims Adjusters
652.description: Authorizes the department of insurance, in lieu of an in-state licensing examination, to recognize the competence of an applicant for an insurance claims adjuster through an out-of-state proctored examination.

653.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
653.title: Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act
653.description: Creates Consumer Protection in Eye Care Act which establishes standards for eye care.

654.title: Insurance
654.description: Eliminates the notarization requirement for a certificate of title or salvage certificate of title to be filed by insurance companies when the damage to the vehicle results in a total loss.

655.title: Risk-based Capital
655.description: RBC) FOR INSURERS ACT (Updates the Life Risk Based Capital statutes to the current National Association of Insurance Commissioners standard.

656.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/10/2020)
656.title: Personal Delivery Devices
656.description: Establishes rules and regulations concerning the use and registration of personal delivery devices and mobile carrying devices.

657.title: Insurance Data Security Act
657.description: Adopts NAIC Cybersecurity Act which establishes the current standard for insurers doing business in the state.

658.title: Long-term Care Insurance
658.description: Updates the long-term care insurance statute into conformance with the latest version of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners model.

659.title: Relating To Insurance
659.description: Brings the Rhode Island Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Fund statute into conformance with the latest version of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Model Act.

661.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
661.title: Net-metering
661.description: Replaces term multi-municipal with multi-party and defines it as combination of 2 or more eligible parties that enter into agreement for purpose of co-owning one or more eligible net-metering resources or entering into financing arrangement(s).

663.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
663.title: Architects
663.description: Allows superior court judge to require a review of compliance that architectural plan services were performed by certified architects.

664.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Rhode Island Transparency And Privacy Protection Act
664.description: Creates "Rhode Island Transparency and Privacy Act" which mandates websites that collect or store personal info to disclose practice.

665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
665.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Filing Of Assumed Name
665.description: Makes amendments necessary to use the term "trade name" rather than "assumed name", for purposes of the commercial law chapter on filing an assumed name, and provides for the administration and regulation of the use of trade names.

666.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
666.description: Prohibits any entity or individual from advertising the sale, purchase, receipt, transport, delivery or salvage of any junk or discarded automobile unless the advertiser is a licensed auto wrecking or salvage yard.

667.title: Indecent Deceptive Trade Practices, Duties Of Carriers Community Standards Of Decency, Adult Entertainment Establishments -- Human Trafficking And Child Exploitation Prevention Act
667.description: Creates a comprehensive statutory scheme to fund, address and support the amelioration of human trafficking and child exploitation by regulating online pornographic related websites.

668.title: Right To Earn A Living Act
668.description: Establishes procedures to ensure that agency regulations do not unjustly restrict individuals from entering into businesses, professions and public services requiring articulable, legitimate public health, safety and welfare objectives.

669.title: The Rhode Island Limited-liability Company Act
669.description: Permits a member or members of a limited-liability company to avoid dissolution by buying the units owned by the other member or members seeking dissolution.

675.title: Relating To Public Property And Works-labor And Payment Of Debts By Contractors
675.description: Relieves regulatory burden by authorizing submission of certified payroll using federal forms for all public works.

677.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
677.description: Requires any public utility or its contractor to reimburse an excavator for lost time expense incurred, including manpower and equipment from the utility's incorrect marking of underground utilities.

680.title: Regional Vocational Schools--see Title 16 Chapter 97--the Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
680.description: Seeks to advance economic development by guaranteeing students the right to enroll in approved career technical educational programs and would allow them to enroll outside the district of residence if their district does not offer a duplicate program.

681.title: Oversight Of Risk-bearing Provider Organizations
681.description: Provides the office of the health insurance commissioner (OHIC) with oversight of risk-bearing provider organizations and health care risk contracts.

682.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
682.title: Compulsory Attendance
682.description: Directs school districts experiencing high rates of student absenteeism to establish attendance review teams to address this absenteeism.

684.title: Governor's Council On Behavioral Health
684.description: Increases the membership of the governor's council on behavioral health from thirty-one (31) to thirty-two (32) members by adding the president of the Hospital Association of Rhode Island or a designee.

685.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
685.title: Children With Disabilities
685.description: Makes explicit that parents and guardians of children with disabilities in private school have the same rights and remedies as parents of children in public school. It also provides a procedure in superior court to enforce these rights and remedies.

686.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
686.description: Requires the Board of Medical Licensure and Discipline to provide for reciprocal licensure of physicians from other jurisdictions under certain conditions, and in connection therewith, requires the board to promulgate applicable rules and regulations.

690.title: Health Information Exchange
690.description: Providers that participate in HIE must provide their patients with information they can opt out of disclosure of information from the HIE.

691.title: Compensation For Students Participating In Intercollegiate Athletics
691.description: Allows expressly allow college athletes, while they are students, to personally profit from the use of their name, image, and likeness, and prohibit the NCAA from preventing these practices.

692.title: Life-saving Allergy Medication--stock Syringe Epinephrine Auto-injectors--emergency Administration
692.description: Requires the owner's or operators of any public place, which is an area capable of holding 300 people or more and to which the public is invited or permitted to have available epinephrine auto-injectors and trained personnel to administer it.

695.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/11/2020)
695.title: Mandatory Educational Community Service
695.description: Requires all students in kindergarten to grade twelve (K-12) to perform a minimum amount of community service each school year and would grant them the option to perform certain forms of community service for academic credit.

696.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
696.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools
696.description: Provides an exception to required school immunizations for pupils whose personal, philosophical, or religious beliefs are contrary to immunization and/or testing.

697.title: Central Service Technicians
697.description: Provides for licensing and regulation of central service technicians.

698.title: Department Of Health
698.description: Prevents the director of health from making any regulation in the adult day care program licensure process discriminating against or giving preference to the number of adult participants receiving adult day care services based upon their age group.

700.title: Laboratories
700.description: Creates a comprehensive system to promote and regulate the effective and competent administration of medical laboratories by focusing on the training, qualifications and licensure of their practitioners.

701.title: Pharmacies - Tobacco Cessation Therapy
701.description: Authorizes a licensed pharmacist, who successfully completes a course on tobacco cessation therapy, to prescribe and dispense tobacco cessation drug products to a qualified patient pursuant to rules adopted by the board of pharmacy.

703.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
703.title: Access To Advanced Placement Courses For All Students Act
703.description: Updates Access to Advanced Placement Courses for All Students Act.

705.title: Health Department Medical Care
705.description: Requires the director of the department of health to develop and administer a program of on-call physicians to make home visits to elderly residents unable to travel to the doctor's office without assistance.

707.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
707.title: Charter Schools
707.description: Allows charter schools to engage in nontraditional approaches to learning and for student enrollment for new charter schools in transportation districts to be the same as other charter schools.

708.title: "the Rhode Island Informed Consent Protection Act"
708.description: Requires written consent by recipient or parent before vaccine and prohibits discrimination against those who don't vaccinate and fines up to $25,000 for violation. Also prohibits DCYF from investigating for failure to vaccinate.

709.title: Curriculum [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
709.description: Provides that any school teaching sexual education to students shall provide the sexual education curriculum to every parent or guardian of a student, and the parent or legal guardian shall consent to the teaching of such sexual education curriculum.

710.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
710.title: Compulsory Attendance--see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
710.description: Provides that the public schools shall be responsible for attendance data monitoring and detection of emergent truant behavior.

711.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
711.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education
711.description: Requires the council of elementary and secondary education take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students across municipal boundaries.

714.title: Lifetime Limits
714.description: Revokes the authority of the health insurance commissioner's ability to enforce a ruling of the federal government or federal court that revokes the prohibition on limits on health insurance.

715.title: Suicide Prevention--the Nathan Bruno And Jason Flatt Act
715.description: Creates the "Nathan Bruno and Jason Flatt Act" which would require training of teachers and school personnel regarding suicide awareness and prevention and establishment of a conflict resolution process between teachers or school personnel and students.

716.title: License Procedure For Social Workers
716.description: Defines the educational requirements necessary to qualify an individual as a social worker, and further exempts social workers from the license procedures for licensed clinical social workers and licensed independent clinical social workers.

717.title: Regulation Of Personal Care Products
717.description: Requires the personal care product industry to more fully disclose the ingredients they use and, where applicable, identify ingredients that have been published as a chemical of concern on one or more designated list included in the act.

718.title: License Of Naturopathy Act
718.description: Changes the name of doctor or naturopathy to naturopathic doctor and permit them to administer IVs perform phlebotomy, and consult, but not change, patient’s prescription medication.

719.title: Rights Of Nursing Home Patients
719.description: Establishes minimum staffing levels for nursing facilities.

725.title: Office Of State Medical Examiners
725.description: Removes the sunset date of December 31, 2020, for the multidisciplinary team review of drug-related overdose deaths.

726.title: Opioid Alternatives
726.description: DOH to develop and publish opioid alternative pamphlet.

729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
729.title: Relating To Education-- School Committees And Superintendents
729.description: Requires that any municipal contract modifications, change orders or supplemental agreements to an existing contract in excess of $1,000,000 be subject to the procurement procedures required for the initial award of the contract.

735.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
735.title: Department Of State -- Award Of Municipal Contracts
735.description: Provides that the secretary of state establish a registry for publication of municipal invitations for bids and that municipalities publish notice of invitations for bids with the registry.

736.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
736.title: Award Of Municipal Contracts
736.description: Increases the aggregate amount of procurements for cities and towns from $10,000 to $25,000 for construction and from $5,000 to $10,000 for all other purchases.

737.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
737.title: Transportation Network Company Services
737.description: Allows New Shoreham to regulate transportation network company services.

738.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
738.title: New Shoreham Affordable Housing Eligibility
738.description: Increases the percentage of area median income from one hundred twenty percent (120%) to one hundred forty percent (140%) only for New Shoreham residents to make more households eligible for affordable housing.

739.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
739.title: Explosives - Notice
739.description: Expands the notice requirements relating to the use of explosives by requiring fourteen (14) days' notice of blasting to the municipality and to owners of structures within five hundred feet (500') of the mutual property line.

740.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
740.title: Low- And Moderate-income Housing
740.description: When calculating its number of low- & moderate-income housing units to not consider certain residential units constructed/to be constructed on certain identified assessor's lots located at the Boulder Hills Preserve as yr-round housing units in Richmond.

741.title: Size, Weight And Load Limits--smithfield And Lincoln
741.description: Prohibits commercial motor trucks, with a gross weight rating of twenty-six thousand one pounds (26,001 lbs.) or more, from traveling on Limerock Road, in Smithfield and Lincoln.

742.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
742.title: Subdivision Of Land
742.description: Reduces time to certify minor development plans. Increases time to certify master/prelim plans. Reduces time to certify/resubmit final plan phase. Increases time for master plan decision. Restores preliminary plan decision to 120 days.

743.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
743.title: Housing Maintenance And Occupancy Code
743.description: Landlords responsible to tenants if tenants evicted due to landlord neglect and allows municipality to place lien on property.

744.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
744.title: Quadricycle Passenger Vehicles
744.description: Authorizes municipalities to regulate the use of quadricycle passenger vehicles within their borders.

745.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
745.title: Creating The Hope Valley And Wyoming Fire District
745.description: Creating the Hope Valley and Wyoming fire district

746.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
746.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
746.description: Requires any person who sustains an injury to themselves or causes an injury to another while hunting or trapping to report the injury to the department of environmental management immediately.

747.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
747.title: Appliance And Equipment Energy And Water Efficiency Standards Of 2020
747.description: Establishes minimum energy/water efficiency standards for appliances/specified equipment purchased/installed after 7/1/21.

748.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
748.title: Agricultural Functions
748.description: Provides alternative procedures if the department of environmental management (DEM) fails to adhere to statutory time limits by utilizing registered professional engineers to be paid by DEM.

749.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
749.title: Refuse Disposal
749.description: Requires certain businesses and educational facilities that produce at least 52 tons of organic-waste yearly and are located within 30 miles of an authorized composting facility to use authorized methods of recycling.

750.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
750.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife –- Field Trials And Shooting Preserves
750.description: Defines captive hunting as a hunt that occurs within a structure designed to restrict the free movement of animals and prevents the animal from escaping and would prohibit captive hunting within the state of Rhode Island.

751.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
751.title: Control Of Mosquitoes And Ticks
751.description: Establishes a program for mosquito/tick control by DOH/DEM to coordinate state response to stop the spread of mosquito/tick-borne diseases.

752.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
752.title: Fort Adams Foundation
752.description: Allows the director to appoint a representative of the division of parks and recreation to the Fort Adams Foundation.

753.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/12/2020)
753.title: Plastic Recycling And Litter Act
753.description: Creates voluntary, no charge program for caterers/mobile food vendors/restaurants for reduction of plastic/other disposal waste with successful completion resulting in2 year exemption from payment for litter control permit.

754.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
754.title: State Affairs And Government - Health And Safety
754.description: Updates and modernize the Department of Environmental Management’s ability to enforce environmental laws.

756.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
756.title: Hours And Scheduling
756.description: Requires employers to give their employees at least two (2) weeks notice of their work schedule and other notices scheduling rights and remedies.

757.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
757.title: Employment Of People With Disabilities
757.description: Sets a goal for the habilitation facilities to participate in state procurements and construction projects of less than three percent (3%) of the total value of all contracts available to businesses in each fiscal year by June 30, 2022.

758.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
758.title: Work On Holidays And Sundays
758.description: Requires an individual employer to meet certain criteria in order to qualify for class exemption from the increased pay requirement for work on holidays and Sundays.

760.title: The Life Appropriations Act
760.description: Creates the life appropriations act prohibiting public dollars from the state of Rhode Island to be awarded to any entity that performs convenience abortions.

761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
761.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
761.description: Extends injured-on-duty benefits to police officers and firefighters that suffer from a diagnosis of post-traumatic stress disorder under certain conditions.

766.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
766.title: Appointment, Qualification, And Tenure Of Officers
766.description: Requires that all persons serving on boards and commissions appointed by the governor have a connection to the state through residence or licensure.

771.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
771.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages-manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
771.description: Requires manufacturers with on premises sales to maintain liquor liability insurance and comply with server training and health regulations. Effective January 1, 2021.

773.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
773.title: Retail Licenses--small Business--omnibus
773.description: Omnibus act regarding caterers, hide and leather inspection, constables, sterilization of bedding, mixed-martial arts and pool halls.

774.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
774.title: Department Of Labor And Training
774.description: Enables military service members and their spouses and those individuals certified or licensed in another state to obtain certifications and licenses issued by the department of labor and training subject to certain conditions.

775.title: Trial
775.description: Allows counsel in a criminal trial to argue jury nullification as a defense.

776.title: Relating To Election S-- Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
776.description: Makes the chairperson of a political action committee or political party committee responsible for fines levied by the board of elections.

778.title: Residence For Voting Purposes
778.description: Tightens up the definition of domicile for purposes of voting, especially with regard to prospective voters who own more than one residential property, by identifying specific relevant documentary evidence and information.

779.title: Professional Responsibility--criminal Records Review
779.description: Requires patient contact employees, personal care attendants and high-risk providers to undergo a national criminal records check and would disqualify those people if they have a criminal record for crimes of violence or other offenses listed.

781.title: Airports And Landing Fields -- Airport Zoning
781.description: Adds the terms "approach" and "approach zones" to mean airport land and airspace as defined by the FAA.

782.title: Registration Of Voters
782.description: Updates the mailing address of the board of elections to 2000 Plainfield Pike, Cranston, RI and reduces the number of signatures required of candidates for senator and representative Congress for the 2020 election only.

784.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
784.title: Litter Control And Recycling
784.description: Adds "cigarette butts" to the definition of "litter".

786.title: Noncompetition Agreements - Broadcast Employees
786.description: Prohibits the inclusion of noncompete agreements in broadcast industry employment contracts that are entered into after January 1, 2021.

787.title: Rhode Island Pain-capable Unborn Child Protection Act
787.description: Creates the Rhode Island Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act, prohibiting the performance or induction of an abortion of an unborn child capable of feeling pain, unless necessary to prevent serious health risk to the unborn child’s mother. Eff 1/1/21

788.title: Chiara's Law -- Screening And Education Of Children With Dyslexia
788.description: Requires screening for dyslexia and related disorders for public school students in grades kindergarten through grade four (K-4) and would provide for instruction in cursive writing.

789.title: The College Crusade Scholarship
789.description: Provides that scholarships received directly from the College Crusade Scholarship Program would not be considered financial aid pursuant to the Rhode Island Promise Scholarships and provides the program with access to certain student data.

791.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness -- The Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2020
791.description: Creates "The Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act of 2020," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

792.title: Procedure Generally - Causes Of Action
792.description: Provides for a cause of action against an individual or entity that prohibits the possession of firearms on real property by an individual that is authorized and licensed to carry a firearm.

795.title: Historic Residence--tax Credit
795.description: Amends the definition of "Commission" to include the Cumberland local historic district commission.

796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
796.title: Procedures Generally
796.description: Provides an employer that completed a reasonable background investigation of an employee prior to hiring with a presumption that the employer was not negligent in hiring that employee.

798.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes--liability And Computation
798.description: Allows a credit against the Rhode Island estate tax in the amount of ninety-nine thousand six hundred dollars ($99,600) for decedents dying after December 31, 2020.

799.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
799.title: School Bus Safety Enforcement
799.description: Considers the lessee of a leased vehicle as the owner of the motor vehicle for purposes of this section.

800.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Special Legislation
800.title: Parking Facilities And Privileges
800.description: Authorizes the division of motor vehicles to issue special plates for persons suffering from permanent or long-term disability who own motor vehicles registered with the division instead of a motor vehicle disability parking privilege placard.

802.title: Rhode Island Pay For Success Act
802.description: Establishes a pay for success program to raise funds from non-state government investors to pay for addressing social challenges. If there are positive results, the state would repay the investors with interest.

803.title: Establishing Protection From Partial Birth Abortion

804.title: Medical Assistance -- Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
804.description: Provides for Medicaid home care and keeps high-acuity or high medical necessity patients out of skilled nursing facilities and remain safe at home.

805.title: Transportation Network Company Services - Wheelchair Lift Equipment Vehicles
805.description: Requires ride-sharing services to provide wheelchair lift equipment vehicles as part of their fleet.

808.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-weapons
808.description: Requires person selling firearm to require purchaser execute a medical release form for release of medical records relating to addiction to controlled substance, alcoholism and/or mental health illness for a period of 5 years preceding application.

810.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
810.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
810.description: Increases membership from 3 to 5 members/revises siting process to mandate public/municipal participation.

811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
811.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Construction Indemnity Agreements
811.description: Adds a parking lot as a requirement to a contractor agreement to a construction indemnity agreement.

812.title: Employee Criminal Records Check
812.description: Requires all applicants for employment with the department of BHDDH or any of its licensed facilities or programs to have the attorney general's office conduct their mandated nationwide criminal records check.

818.title: Anti-bullying Bill Of Rights Act
818.description: Creates anti-bullying bill of rights to strengthen protection for students who are victims of bullying.

819.title: Relating To Public Officers And Employees
819.description: Provides parity for state public safety professionals with public safety employees in municipal retirement system eff. 7/1/20/sets retirement contribution at 10% of compensation.

820.title: Relating To Elections
820.description: Eliminates the requirement that to vote, a person must be registered in the city or town and voting district at least thirty (30) days next preceding any election. Effective July 1, 2020.

821.title: Computer Crime
821.description: Allows for a civil action against parents of a student who demonstrates disregard for the suspension of their child who has committed the offense of cyber-stalking or cyber-harassment.

822.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
822.title: Division Of Personnel Administration
822.description: Makes numerous changes to the merit system.

823.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
823.title: Acquisition Of Property By Eminent Domain
823.description: Provides that the NBC may not exercise its power to acquire land within the East Providence Waterfront Special Development District, without approval by the East Providence Waterfront Commission and from the mayor of East Providence.

824.title: Equal Opportunity And Affirmative Action -- Licensing
824.description: Creates a new process with standards to be utilized when deciding whether an applicant's past conviction of a crime should disqualify the applicant from receiving an occupational license, permit, certificate, or registration issued by the state.

826.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/10/2020)
826.title: Secretary Of State
826.description: Creates an election systems cybersecurity review board and a cybersecurity incident response group to establish protocols for cybersecurity threats.

830.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
830.title: Days Of Special Observance -- Medal Of Honor Day
830.description: Designates March 25th as Medal of Honor Day.

833.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
833.title: Relating To Corporations, Associations, And Partnerships
833.description: Allows nonprofit corporations to merge pr consolidate with other business entities or to convert into an other business entity within or outside of this state. It allows other business entities to convert to domestic nonprofit corporations.

834.title: Education Of Children With Dyslexia And Related Disorders
834.description: Provides that if a school district establishes an Orton-Gillingham certified school, the program would be available to all students statewide who qualify.

835.title: Arianna's Speech Fluency Act
835.description: Provides that the general assembly would appropriate $50,000 annually for teacher training in Orton-Gillingham classroom educator program.

838.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
838.description: Requires a health plan to cover clinically appropriate and medically necessary residential or inpatient services, including detoxification and stabilization services, for the treatment of mental health and substance use disorders.

842.title: Medical Assistance-health Care For Elderly And Disabled
842.description: Increases medical assistance coverage for medical assistance coverage/income eligibility for Medicaid cost-sharing for individuals with incomes not to exceed 135% of the federal poverty.

843.title: Retirement System--membership And Service Credits
843.description: Exempts active members of the retirement system employed as state public safety professionals from the cost to purchase credit for military service and interest charges.

847.title: Self-service Storage Insurance
847.description: Provides for the sale of self-service storage insurance in this state.

848.title: Rhode Island Economic Growth Blockchain Act
848.description: Establishes an economic growth blockchain act, set regulations for the sale of hemp, regulate virtual and digital assets and establish depository banks for these purposes.

849.title: Procedure Generally - Levy And Sale On Execution
849.description: Exempts from attachment five hundred dollars ($500) in savings or deposits in financial or banking institutions.

851.title: Rights And Duties Teachers Generally - September 11 Classroom Moment Of Silence
851.description: Allows teachers in all grades to provide the opportunity for students to observe a brief moment of silence on every September 11.

852.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools--see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
852.description: Prohibits the use of a school district's listserv to distribute any political advertisement, invitation, and/or propaganda.

854.title: Contractors' Registration And Licensing Board
854.description: Changes the continuing education requirements of registered contractors to ten (10) hours every two (2) years.

855.title: Catastrophic Illness In Children Relief Fund
855.description: Establishes Children's Catastrophic Illness in Children Relief Fund to provide finance assistance to families for medical expenses not covered by state or federal programs or insurance contract.

858.title: Criminal Harassment
858.description: Creates the offense of criminal harassment to prosecute persons who willfully and maliciously engage in a pattern of conduct which seriously alarms another person.

860.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Special Legislation
860.title: Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses - Breweries And Distilleries
860.description: Modifies limitations on quantities of malt beverages and distilled spirits that can be sold at retail by certain licensed breweries and distilleries for off-premises consumption.

861.title: Insurance Benefits
861.description: Entitles correctional officers who have a minimum of twenty-five (25) years of service and who are at least fifty-five (55) years of age to receive a non-Medicare-eligible retiree health care insurance benefit.

862.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
862.description: Requires state contracted human services providers to pay their employees a starting hourly wage of no less than one hundred forty-four percent (144%) of the state minimum wage.

863.title: Distributed Generation Interconnection
863.description: Requires the electric distribution company to report interconnection studies and not charge more than actual costs for the studies.

864.title: Medical Marijuana
864.description: Adds a definition to the term "manufacture" in the medical marijuana chapter.

865.title: Authorizing The Town Of Jamestown To Finance Library Renovations, Repairs And/or Expansion And/or Related Equipment By The Issuance Of Not More Than $1,500,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
865.description: Authorizes the Town of Jamestown to issue not more than $1,500,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements at the town’s library and related equipment.

869.title: Authorizing The Town Of Middletown To Finance Acquiring And Preserving Open Space And Acquiring, Preserving, Restoring And Improving Recreational Areas In The Town By The Issuance Of Not More Than $5,000,000 Bonds And/or Notes Therefor
869.description: Authorizes Middletown to issue up to $5,000,000 in bonds/notes to acquire/preserve open space/restore improve recreational areas subject to voter appeal.

870.title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill Of Rights
870.description: Amends the law enforcement officers' bill of rights to provide greater accountability over the disciplinary process over law enforcement.

873.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Issue Not To Exceed $147,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The City, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 50% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
873.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue $147,000,000 general obligation bonds for school facility improvements upon voter approval.

874.title: Authorizing The City Of Newport To Issue Not To Exceed $106,500,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance All Costs Relating To The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of:
874.description: I) AN ADDITION TO THE CLAIBORNE PELL ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, CLASSROOMS AND ASSOCIATED SUPPORT SPACE, SITE IMPROVEMENTS, AND PARKING AND (II) A NEW SCHOOL FACILITY FOR THE WILLIAM S. ROGERS HIGH SCHOOL, PROVIDED THAT THE AUTHORIZATION SHALL BE REDUCED BY THE AMOUNT OF CERTAIN GRANTS RECEIVED FROM STATE BOND PROCEEDS, FROM THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION OR FROM THE RHODE ISLAND SCHOOL BUILDING AUTHORITY (Authorizes the city of Newport to issue not more than $106,500,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance all costs relating to school improvements.

875.title: Authorizing The City Of Warwick To Issue Not To Exceed $56,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The City, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Fiscal Years 2022 Through 2026, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 35% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
875.description: Authorizes Warwick to issue up to fifty-six million dollars ($56,000,000) in bonds/notes for schools/school facilities upon voter approval.

876.title: Authorizing The Town Of Burrillville To Issue Not To Exceed $7,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, And All Attendant Expenses Including, But Not Limited To, Engineering And Architectural Costs, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 45% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
876.description: Authorizes the town of Burrillville to issue not more than $7,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair, landscaping, furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities.

880.title: Civil Air Patrol
880.description: Authorizes state aide to RICAP for training/equipment for use during times of natural disaster/emergency as needed by state EMA/governor.

881.title: Making An Appropriation To Pay Certain Vietnam Bonuses
881.description: Appropriates the sum of two hundred dollars ($200) for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2020, for payment of the Vietnam bonus of Jeffrey W. Dress of Marlboro, Massachusetts.

883.title: In Amendment Of Chapter 974 Of The Public Laws Of 1940, Entitled "to Incorporate The Stone Bridge Fire District And To Furnish A Supply Of Water For The Town Of Tiverton"
883.description: Authorizes the Stone Bridge fire district to borrow up to $100,000 in funds to meet specific short-term financial obligations.

887.title: Authorizing The Town Of South Kingstown To Finance The Town's Capital Improvement Plan For The Fiscal Years 2020-2026, Including, But Not Limited To, The Acquisition, Construction, Replacement, Repair, Improvement, Furnishing And Equipping Of Municipal Transportation Safety And Road Improvements, Public Safety Infrastructure Improvements And Other Municipal Projects, By The Issuance Of Not More Than $6,500,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
887.description: Authorizes the town of South Kingstown to issue not more than $6,500,000 bonds and notes to finance the town’s capital improvement plan for the fiscal years 2020-2026.

890.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Planning, Evaluation, Design, Construction, Equipping And Reconstruction Of The Sanitary Sewers And Storm Sewers In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2022 And 2023
890.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, and notes to finance the planning, evaluation, design, construction, equipping and reconstruction of the sewer and sanitation system.

891.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Improvement And Replacement Of Road Safety Improvements And Traffic Control Devices In The City Of Pawtucket And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2022 And 2023

892.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $4,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, repair, alteration, furnishing and equipping of public buildings.

893.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Design, Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Sidewalks And Other Transportation Infrastructure Improvements Including, But Not Limited To, Drainage And Landscaping And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2022 And 2023
893.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, and notes to finance design, construction, reconstruction and repair of sidewalks including, drainage and landscaping.

894.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Renovation, Construction, Reconstruction And Equipping Of Public Recreation Facilities In The City Including Land Acquisition And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $4,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2022 And 2023
894.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $4,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes for the renovation, construction, reconstruction and equipping of public recreation facilities of indebtedness to finance and all costs related thereto.

895.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Repaving Of Streets In The City And All Costs Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $3,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2022 And 2023
895.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $3,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the repaving of streets.

896.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Environment and Natural Resources
896.title: The Geoengineering Act
896.description: Establishes licensing procedure for persons seeking to engage in geoengineering activity from DEM to protect health/safety/environment of state.

897.title: Inspections
897.description: Authorizes the Exeter town sergeant or designees to conduct division of motor vehicles vehicle identifying number and odometer inspections.

898.title: Covid-19 Pandemic Insurance Recovery Act
898.description: Allows businesses that had an insurance policy in place for business interruption as of March 9, 2019 to recover from their insurance companies for a COVID-19 business impact.

899.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of M.c. Sousa Trucking & Excavation, Inc.
899.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of M.c. Sousa Trucking & Excavation, Inc.

900.title: Workers' Compensation--occupational Diseases
900.description: Establishes that any public safety official/enumerated employee, including essential state workers, who contract the Coronavirus (Covid-19) shall be entitled to a presumption that the infection was caused as a result of the performance of their job duties

901.title: Suicide Treatment Improvement Act
901.description: Provides for the "Suicide Treatment Improvement Act" to improve the delivery of suicide treatment.

906.title: Establishing The Rhode Island Rare Disease Medication Accessibility, Affordability, And Reinsurance Act
906.description: Establishes rare disease mediation reinsurance program.

907.title: Covid-19 Insurance Relief Act
907.description: Requires an insurer to provide business interruption coverage due to the global pandemic COVID-19.

908.title: Emergency Management
908.description: Permits Alcoholics Anonymous and Narcotics Anonymous meetings during a declared disaster emergency.

913.title: Workers' Compensation
913.description: This is the annual workers' compensation omnibus bill. It would slightly alter the process and type of benefits for which work-related injured employees of uninsured employers may seek compensation.

914.title: Party Committees And Conventions
914.description: Provides that endorsements of Providence candidates and nomination papers shall be furnished through the Providence board of canvassers rather than the secretary of state.

916.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the acquisition, improvement, renovation and repair of fire and public safety equipment.

917.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the construction, improvement, renovation, repair, alteration, furnishing and equipping of public buildings.

918.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Finance The Acquisition, Construction, Improvement, Renovation, Repair And Alteration Of Playgrounds, Athletic Fields And Related Equipment In The City By The Issuance Of Not More Than $2,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Therefor
918.description: Authorizes Cranston to issue not more than $2,000,000 general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the acquisition, construction, improvement, renovation, repair and alteration of playgrounds, athletic fields and related equipment.

920.description: Authorizes Cranston to issue not more than Five Million Dollars ($5,000,000) bonds and notes for the acquisition, equipping and installation of renewable energy and energy conservation improvements in public buildings.

922.title: Relating To Statutory Construction
922.description: This act makes a number of technical amendments to the general laws, prepared at the recommendation of the Law Revision Office.

924.title: Authorizing The Town Of Portsmouth To Issue Not To Exceed $65,900,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Additions, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 35% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
924.description: Authorizes the town of Portsmouth to issue bonds and notes to finance the construction, additions, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair, furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities throughout the town.

926.title: Minimum Housing Standards
926.description: Repeals the selection and organization of a housing board of review for the Town of Westerly.

927.title: Relating To Consolidation Of The Albion And Saylesville Fire Districts Into The New Lincoln Fire District
927.description: Extends the deadline for the merger of the Albion and Saylesville Fire Districts into the New Lincoln Fire District until December 31, 2021.

929.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Lawrence-sunset Cove Association

933.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Migrant, Llc
933.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Migrant, Llc

936.title: Explosives And Fireworks
936.description: Limits the sale of fireworks to one week prior to and including the 4th day in July, and may only be used, exploded, or cause to exploded between 6 p.m. and 9 p.m.

937.title: Minority Business Enterprise
937.description: Redefines contractor and minority business enterprise to include any business, profit or nonprofit, organized under laws of any state, even if located outside RI, would apply to RIDOT contracts and relieves businesses from having limit on its net worth.

938.title: Authorizing The City Of Providence To Issue Not To Exceed $140,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Landscaping, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The City, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 75% At The Time Of Issuance And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
938.description: Authorizes City of Providence to issue $140,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance, improvements to school buildings and facilities.

939.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
939.title: State Budget Reserve And Cash Stabilization Account
939.description: Increase funding of the budget reserve account, also known as the "Rainy Day Fund," and would limit state spending.

942.title: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland To Issue General Obligation Bonds And/or Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $2,500,000 To Finance The Development, Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair And Equipping Of Recreational Areas And Facilities In The Town
942.description: Authorizes Cumberland to issue $2,500,000 of general obligation bonds and notes in order to finance the development, construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair and equipping of recreational areas and facilities in the town.

945.description: Requires peace officers during any interaction with member of the public to wear and activate body cameras, provided, any officer engaged in under-cover police work, shall not be required to do so. Establishes protocols for retention of footage.

948.title: Patient Visitation Rights
948.description: Entitles all residents of health care and assisted living facilities, nursing homes, group homes and veterans' homes, to designate a person to provide them with companionship, personal health care guidance and advocacy.

949.title: Prompt Payment By Department Of Administration--subcontractor Payments
949.description: Expedites payments on state contracts for subcontractors.

950.title: Establishing A Commission On The Status Of African Americans And Latinxs
950.description: Creates commission on status of African Americans and Latinx. Provides for $2,000,000 appropriation for FY 2021.

952.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Special Legislation

952.description: Eliminates the state holiday of Victory Day and insert in place thereof the state holiday of Emancipation Day to be held on August 1.

953.title: Establishing An Elected And Appointed Minority Officials Commission
953.description: Creates an "Elected and Appointed Minority Officials Commission" to create a record of elected and appointed minority officials from the inception of the state as a settlement in1636 by Roger Williams to the present.

954.description: Establishes a central command video/audio surveillance center administered by the state police. Funding would be provided by use of fifty percent (50%) of the E-911 funds.

955.description: Grants immunity from criminal prosecution under certain circumstances to persons engaged in commercial sexual activity as the victim of or witness to a crime.

958.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Moy Works, Inc.
958.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Moy Works, Inc.
