1202.title: The Board Of Education Act
1202.description: Requires the board of education to develop and implement a 5 year plan to improve student performance in science, technology, engineering, and math and increase the number of postsecondary degrees awarded in STEM fields on or before 2/1/21.

1203.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1203.title: School And Youth Programs Concussion Act
1203.description: Requires all school districts to designate an athletic trainer to be available for high school athletic practices and games.

1204.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1204.title: The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1204.description: Requires that the board of elementary and secondary education adopt a competency-based/proficiency-based learning policy whereby students can earn credits through demonstration of competency.

1205.title: Psychologists
1205.description: Includes licensed school psychologists under the provisions of the general laws governing the regulations of psychologists, and would limit the authorization of school psychologist to practice school psychology to the school setting.

1211.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1211.title: Establishing Appliance And Equipment Energy And Water Efficiency Standards Of 2020
1211.description: Establishes minimum energy and water efficiency standards for appliances and specified equipment purchased or installed after July 1, 2021.

1213.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1213.title: Quasi-public Corporations Accountability And Transparency Act
1213.description: Requires quasi-public corporations to use all funds and property to perform the function or service for which the quasi-public corporation was created.

1214.title: Jobs Development Act
1214.description: Sunsets/discontinues the Jobs Development Act rate reduction as of July 1, 2020.

1218.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Personal Income Tax
1218.description: Subtracts state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for purposes of the state income tax for tax years beginning January 1, 2021, and thereafter.

1219.title: Veterans' Home In House Occupation Therapy
1219.description: Requires the general assembly to appropriate necessary funds for the furnishing of in-house occupational therapy services for all residents of the Bristol Veterans' home.

1220.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
1220.description: Provides that applicants for historic tax credits shall have ninety (90) days after the date of the commission's written determination certifying the rehabilitation to pay the required three percent (3%) non-refundable fee to the division of taxation

1226.title: Micro Zone Economic Revitalization Act
1226.description: Creates micro zones in distressed areas to stimulate economic revitalization, employment opportunities, and business development through the redevelopment of obsolete, dilapidated and abandoned industrial and commercial structures.

1236.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1236.title: Prohibition Of Pfas In Food Packaging Act
1236.description: Prohibits PFAS, a class of fluorinated organic chemicals, from being used in food packaging.

1237.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1237.title: Ensuring Access To High Quality Care For The Treatment Of Substance Use Disorders
1237.description: Establishes the medication assisted treatment (MAT) program which uses medications, in combination with counseling and behavioral therapies, to create a comprehensive approach to the treatment of substance use disorders.

1238.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1238.title: Developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act
1238.description: Creates a developmental disabilities ombudsperson program to be administratively attached to the department of administration.

1245.title: Safety Responsibility Administration -- Security
1245.description: Makes sweeping changes to the motor vehicles laws by repealing the many sections that require the filing of security or bond with the DMV following a motor vehicle accident.

1249.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1249.title: Exploitation Of Elders
1249.description: Changes the definition of "elder person" for purposes of exploitation of elders from a person sixty-five (65) years of age or older to a person sixty (60) years of age or older.

1250.title: Children--confinement In Motor Vehicles Prohibited
1250.description: Repeals the requirement that law enforcement officers issue only warnings of the risks to persons leaving a child under the age of seven (7) unattended in a motor vehicle.

1258.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1258.title: Dignity At Work Act
1258.description: Establishes the Dignity at Work Act, to provide workers with more protection from bullying and harassment in the workplace.

1259.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1259.title: Burial Of Veterans
1259.description: Allows a veteran who qualifies to be buried at the Rhode Island veterans' memorial cemetery to designate a domestic partner to be buried with them.

1267.title: Regional Vocational Schools--see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1267.description: Amends the career and technical education program laws to provide the process by which students could access career and technical education programs outside of their home school district.

1269.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1269.title: Economic And Climate Resilience Act Of 2020
1269.description: Establishes a fee on companies that sell fossil fuels in Rhode Island for consumption or distribution within the state and establishes an "economic and climate resilience fund" to disburse the collected funds.

1272.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1272.title: Idling
1272.description: Removes the word diesel in regard to idling of engines and would pertain to idling of all engines.

1274.title: Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Act
1274.description: Establishes Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Grant to eligible homeowners and renters to retrofit their residence to nationally recognized accessibility standards.

1275.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1275.title: Little Cigar Tax
1275.description: Requires that the tax imposed on little cigars be imposed in the same manner as the tax imposed on cigarettes, that 25% of such tax revenue would be applied to smoking cessation programs, and requires that little cigars be sold in packs of 20 or more.

1279.title: Personal Income Tax - Military Retirement
1279.description: Excludes for the purposes of Rhode Island state income taxes, the first $25,000 of eligible military retirement income, paid by the state or federal government to persons 60 years or older received in the 2021 tax year, and thereafter.

1280.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief
1280.description: Sets regionalization bonus at two percent (2%) of state's share of foundation education aid formula.

1282.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1282.title: Prescription Drug Sales -- Representative Disclosure Act
1282.description: Requires prescription drug manufacturers to file a detailed, updated list of each pharmaceutical sales representative and to pay an annual fee for each name listed with the department of business regulation.

1286.title: Uniform Control Substances Act
1286.description: Requires that professionals authorized to prescribe opioid drugs discuss addiction risks and when appropriate alternative treatments with patients upon the second refill and/or upon the third prescription.

1297.title: Maintenance Of Order On Campus--see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1297.description: Mandates arming campus police at public higher educational institutions and includes campus police in the definition of "law enforcement officer" for the purposes of the "Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."

1305.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1305.title: General Provisions - Manufacturing And Wholesale Licenses
1305.description: Authorizes the issuance of farmer-brewery and farmer-distillery licenses to qualifying farms subject to conditions and regulations issued by the department of regulation.

1307.title: Joint Committee On Legislative Services
1307.description: Includes the majority leader of the senate as a member of the joint committee on legislative services.

1309.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Micron Cmm Services, Llc
1309.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Micron Cmm Services, Llc

1316.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1316.title: Insurance Rates
1316.description: Prevents the consideration of an applicant's credit history in determining automobile insurance rates.

1318.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1318.title: Rhode Island Business Corporations Act -- Nonprofit Corporation Act -- Limited-liability Company Act
1318.description: Removes the ten (10) year period for secretary of state to withdraw a certificate of revocation.

1320.title: Small Loan Lenders
1320.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

1323.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education--see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1323.description: Provides that the commissioner of elementary and secondary education would be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the governor with the advice and consent of the senate.

1324.title: Mayoral Academies
1324.description: Requires the student populations of mayoral academies to reflect the combined demographics of the sending district(s) in terms of the number of students in special education, who are English language learners and who qualify for free and reduced meals.

1335.title: Career And Technical Education
1335.description: Provides that the department of elementary and secondary education, in consultation with a workgroup composed of various stakeholders, develop a funding formula for school districts sending students to career and technical programs outside their district.

1338.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1338.title: Model For Dual Language Immersion Programs
1338.description: Requires the department of education to create a model policy and timeline to assist local education agencies in implementing a dual language immersion program.

1343.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1343.title: The Ocean State Climate Adaptation Fund
1343.description: Establishes the Ocean State Climate Adaptation and Resilience Fund. Enables municipalities and the state to apply for grants to improve public safety and community climate resilience for coastal habitats, as well as river and stream floodplains.

1345.title: Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
1345.description: Provides that for FY 2021, the state pays the local share or contribution of charter public school tuition for its students in excess of 5% of the average of all pupils within school districts.

1349.title: Rebuild Rhode Island Tax Credit
1349.description: Establishes a Pawtucket-Central Falls station redevelopment district and provides that tax credits may be available for certain projects located in the district for an amount not to exceed 50% of the project cost.

1350.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
1350.description: Exempts federally financed housing developments and state nonprofit affordable housing programs from the real estate conveyance tax.

1351.title: State Aid To Libraries
1351.description: Increases the state's share to support local public library services in distressed communities, by an amount equal to the amount paid by the distressed city or town into the ocean state libraries (OSL) annual assessment charges.

1353.title: Stay Invested In Ri Wavemaker Fellowship
1353.description: Repeals the provisions of the Stay Invested in RI Wavemaker Fellowship, and establish the Stay Invested in RI Tax Credit to provide eligible taxpayers with a tax credit for educational loan repayment expenses.

1356.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability Computation
1356.description: Exempts from sales and use taxes: burial containers, urns, urn liners, urn vaults, grave liners, grave vaults, burial liners, burial vaults, burial tent setups, and prayer cards.

1365.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Rules, Government Ethics and Oversight
1365.title: Lean Government Initiative Act
1365.description: Would, through the office of management and budget, implement the Lean government initiative and include a mandatory yearly progress report by departments, agencies, boards and commissions.

1373.title: Sepsis Protocols
1373.description: Requires hospitals to adopt protocols for the early detection and treatment of patients with sepsis.

1378.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1378.title: Comprehensive Discharge Planning
1378.description: Requires hospital to incorporate consent for peer recovery specialist services into comprehensive patient consent form. Creates MAT program using meds and counseling and to create a comprehensive approach to the treatment of substance use disorders.

1380.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act -- Non-opiate Directive
1380.description: Directs filing non-opiate directives with the DOA and deletes requirements for recording in electronic health record and verification by a registered practitioner. Replaces medical disciplinary board with the dept of health for compliance violations.

1383.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1383.title: Licensure Of Interpreters For The Deaf
1383.description: Prohibits a person who is under the age of eighteen (18) to work or volunteer in the medical settings including mental health and behavioral health care facilities for any deaf or hard-of-hearing clients or patients.

1386.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1386.title: Rhode Island Health Information Exchange Act Of 2008
1386.description: Provides patients opportunity to opt out of information disclosure under HIE.

1402.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1402.title: Disorderly Conduct
1402.description: Amends the penalty provisions for disorderly conduct, willful trespass, and shoplifting.

1404.title: Correctional Institutions - Parole
1404.description: Provides that juveniles sentenced as adults parole eligible after completing 15 years of their sentence.

1406.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1406.title: Immigration Status
1406.description: Prohibits a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a tenant, prospective tenant, occupant, or prospective occupant of residential rental property.

1410.title: Local Tobacco Control Act
1410.description: Creates a comprehensive resolution scheme for cities and towns to follow concerning the sale and control of tobacco in their communities.

1413.title: Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
1413.description: Establishes detailed steps and safeguards to create the Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act, to provide a legal mechanism whereby a terminally ill patient may choose to end their life using drugs prescribed by a physician.

1415.title: Procedure Generally -- Fees
1415.description: Allows jurors to donate their juror fees to the state into the general fund.

1419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1419.title: Mortgage Foreclosure And Sale
1419.description: Provides that fifty dollars ($50.00) of the filing fee paid to the HUD-approved agency for the mediation conference involving the mortgagee and mortgagor, shall be paid to the Rhode Island Legal Services.

1420.title: Animal Care -- Uniform Commercial Code -- Leases
1420.description: Prohibits dogs or cats as security for failure to pay.

1423.title: State Affairs And Government - Residence Of Those In Government Custody Act
1423.description: Requires the state to use the actual residence of persons in government custody for redistricting purposes. Their actual residences would be collected by the dept. of corrections and forwarded to the secretary of state to be utilized for redistricting.

1425.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1425.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act - Offenses And Penalties
1425.description: Excludes the possession of buprenorphine from those controlled substances that can result in criminal penalties.

1434.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses--violations
1434.description: Requires that the license plates of a vehicle be confiscated by a police officer if the owner was arrested for driving while their license was suspended, revoked or cancelled for refusing to submit to a chemical test or for operating under the influence.

1435.title: Wrongful Discharge From Employment
1435.description: Ends Rhode Island's "employment-at-will" legal doctrine, and would provide job protection for employees that satisfactorily perform their duties. The act would also provide specific remedies for wrongful discharge.

1443.title: Fair Employment Practices Act
1443.description: Changes the definition of employee and employer for purposes of the fair employment practices act, while expanding personal liability for violations.

1456.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1456.title: Holiday And Sunday Work
1456.description: Removes health care and maintenance workers from the definition of employees not entitled to overtime pay, for purposes of overtime pay on Sundays and holidays, enabling them to collect overtime pay.

1461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1461.title: Drug Cost Transparency Act
1461.description: Requires pharmaceutical drug manufacturers and pharmacy benefit managers to provide wholesale acquisition cost/drug prices/rebates/fees/drug sales information to DOH/Insurance Commissioner yearly.

1477.title: Holley Landing
1477.description: Renames the landing in South Kingstown known as Wordens Pond Landing to Holley Landing.

1478.title: Joint Committee On Naming New Buildings
1478.description: Names Route 4 and Route 1 from Warwick to Westerly The Purple Heart Memorial Highway.

1481.title: Teachers Retirement--see Title 16 Chapter 97-the Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1481.description: Provides for a stipend to be paid to certain retired state employees, municipal employees, and teachers or their beneficiaries during years when a cost of living adjustment is not scheduled.

1484.title: Definition Of Corporate Net Income
1484.description: Repeals a state corporate income tax deduction to allowable income for federal tax purposes for investment property held for at least seven (7) years.

1486.title: State Budget
1486.description: Requires that the governor submit a zero-based budget to the general assembly. The zero-based budget shall be phased in over a five (5) year period.

1487.title: Medical Assistance And Public Assistance Caseload Estimating Conferences
1487.description: Requires the participation and input of the EOHHS, DHS, DCYF and BHDDH in medical assistance and public assistance caseload estimating conferences and the generation of monthly data to the members of the case load estimating conference.

1498.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1498.title: Persons With Mental Illness, Addiction/substance Abuse Disorders And Developmental Disabilities
1498.description: Requires the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals to make or cause to be made unannounced inspections and investigations of community residences.

1502.title: Utility District Energy Costs
1502.description: Requires the state to pay the energy costs necessary to supply public street lighting if the local utility district fails to do so.

1503.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1503.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Interest And Usury
1503.description: Reduces the usury rate to twelve percent (12%).

1509.title: Financial Literacy
1509.description: Develops statewide academic standards for the instruction of consumer education in public high schools by no later than December 31, 2020.

1512.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1512.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals
1512.description: Amend the definition of "individualized program plan" by adding the language requiring the evaluation be accomplished through an independent third party.

1514.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1514.title: Health Care Insurers -- Coordination Of Benefits
1514.description: Authorizes the department of business regulation to determine the status of insurers for coordination of benefits purposes when there are two or more insurers.

1520.title: In Amendment To The Charter Of The Central Coventry Fire District Pursuant To A Resolution Of The Board Of Directors Of The Coventry Fire District On December 27, 2018
1520.description: Makes various amendments pertaining to the duties and operations of the Central Coventry Fire District.

1521.title: Volunteer Firefighter/emergency Medical Technician Property Tax Exemption Enabling Legislation
1521.description: Allows municipalities to establish a program providing property tax exemption to active duty individuals who volunteer services as a firefighter or emergency medical technician.

1522.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1522.title: Maintenance Of Town Highways
1522.description: Requires DOT to repair, maintain and keep free from ice or snow all sidewalks running along state highways.

1524.title: Training And Evaluation - Evaluation Requirements
1524.description: Directs the council on elementary/secondary education to implement assessment/evaluation systems for teachers/administrators.

1526.title: Ensuring Proper Reporting
1526.description: Requires local education entities to develop and maintain a system to report teacher absences to the department of elementary and secondary education.

1527.title: Certification Of Teachers - Testing Requirements For New Teachers
1527.description: Establish testing requirements for initial certification of new teachers on or after July 1, 2022.

1531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1531.title: Renewable Energy Standard
1531.description: Sets forth standards ensuring full compliance with non-renewable energy standards by 2030, commencing in compliance year 2021.

1536.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriations
1536.description: Requires that penalties or restitution payments for larceny of a campaign account or campaign expenditure reporting violations be deposited into the Rhode Island crime victim compensation program fund and not into the candidate's campaign account.

1541.title: Operators' License -- Safe Roads And Mandatory Insurance
1541.description: Requires an applicant for a license to have a social security number for license. Creates an alternate ID for applicants without a social security number.

1542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1542.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Establishing The Electronic Information Or Data Privacy Act
1542.description: Electronic Information or Data Privacy Act. Limits law enforcement access to electronic data and information.

1544.title: Claims For Wrongful Conviction And Imprisonment
1544.description: Enables innocent persons who have been wrongfully convicted of a crime to petition the presiding justice of the superior court for an award of compensation and damages.

1546.title: Primaries
1546.description: Requires that on all primaries, the candidate's names would be listed in an order chosen by lot under the direction of the secretary of state.

1549.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1549.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Deceptive Trade Practices
1549.description: Amends the Deceptive Trade Practices Act to clarify the law's exemptions/enables individuals subject to unfair or deceptive acts and practices to recover increased damages/permits attorney general to seek civil penalties for initial violations of law.

1551.title: Vital Records
1551.description: Requires funeral directors/agents to notify secretary of state and the board of canvassers upon filing death certificate for the purpose of removal from the roles of registered voters.

1554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1554.title: Consumer Privacy Protection

1557.title: Divorce And Separation -- Child Support
1557.description: Allows for the extension of child support obligations for non-custodial parents beyond emancipation if the children are attending a two or four year college and still live with the custodial parent until such children reach the age of twenty-one.

1562.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Rules, Government Ethics and Oversight
1562.title: Electronic Voting
1562.description: Requires the joint committee on legislative services to make the record of the votes of the general assembly available to the public and the secretary of state electronically within thirty (30) minutes of the casting of said vote.

1582.title: Fiscal Notes
1582.description: Establishes special requirements for fiscal impact statements relative to the department of corrections.

1584.title: Relating To Education-curriculum
1584.description: Requires elementary schools to provide instruction in cursive penmanship.

1589.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1589.title: Vaccine Adverse Events Reporting Act
1589.description: Establishes reporting system to DOH to detect and report vaccine adverse events from vaccine providers.

1590.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1590.title: Privatization Of State Services
1590.description: Prohibits the privatization of municipal services until the processes and procedures contained in the laws regulating the privatization of state services have been complied with.

1593.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1593.title: Construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
1593.description: Prohibits the cutting, pruning or removal of shade or ornamental trees along all public roads without the permission of the director of the department of transportation.

1594.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1594.title: Public Parking Commission
1594.description: Repeals the public law establishing a public parking commission in the town of Westerly.

1596.title: Relating To Coventry Sewer Authority
1596.description: Prohibits the town of Coventry from assessing the costs of repaving the roadway upon the completion of any sewage works upon the land owners.

1598.title: Mail Ballots - Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
1598.description: Requires any person voting by mail ballot or emergency mail ballot to provide proof of identity, exempting those who are hospitalized or residents in a hospice or skilled nursing facility.

1600.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations
1600.description: Requires most employers in Rhode Island to participate in the E/Verify employment authorization program and establishes deadlines to do so.

1603.title: Hotels - Unlicensed Rentals Act
1603.description: Establishes rules and regulations concerning rentals of residences for less than thirty (30) days.

1604.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1604.title: Public Accountancy
1604.description: Removes crime of moral turpitude as cause to deny a variety of licenses.

1605.title: City Housing Authority
1605.description: Prohibits discrimination against criminally convicted persons in public housing project assignments/exception made for sexual assault violations and offenses that require registration.

1606.title: Salaries And Traveling Expenses
1606.description: Requires all non-supervisory classified employees to electronically record their daily work hours.

1608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1608.title: Inspection Frequency
1608.description: Changes the frequency of motor vehicle inspections from yearly to every two (2) years to be conducted at the same their emissions inspection is performed.

1611.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Indecent Deceptive Trade Practices
1611.description: Provides Internet devices and have obscene material filters. Creates grant fund for survivors of sex-related offenses.

1614.title: Transportation Network Company Services - Town Of New Shoreham
1614.description: Provides New Shoreham has the exclusive authority to prescribe rules and regulations pertaining to the operation, licensing, and regulation of transportation network service companies and their services when TNCs are operating in the town of New Shoreham.

1615.title: Internet Filtering In Schools
1615.description: School Internet filtering policy prohibits pornography.

1621.title: Federal Aid
1621.description: Requires free lunches to be provided for all elementary and secondary students attending public schools, to the extent state and federal funds are available.

1623.title: Education Equality - Community Schools Act
1623.description: Furnish financial support for the planning and implementation of effective community schools that would provide students with equitable access to a high-quality education.

1624.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1624.title: Mechanical Trades -- Purchase And Sale Restriction Of Refrigerant
1624.description: Requires compliance with 40 C.F.R § 82.150 – 161 that prevents the sale, distribution or purchase of ozone depleting substances and authorizes director of labor and training to enforce provisions.

1634.title: Health Care For Children And Pregnant Women
1634.description: Allow pregnant women with an annual family income above the applicable Medicaid income limit to be eligible to purchase health insurance through one of the Medicaid managed care plans.

1639.title: The Rhode Island Health Care Reform Act Of 2004--health Insurance Oversight
1639.description: Have the health insurance commissioner adopt a uniform set of medical criteria for prior authorization and create required forms to be used by a health insurer, including telemedicine coverage.

1641.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1641.title: Graduate Medical Education
1641.description: Allows the executive office of health and human services to use appropriated funds to support graduate medical education programs and research. At the same time implementing the appropriate payment mechanism in order to make the payments annually.

1643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1643.title: Alcoholism
1643.description: Requires the dept of behavioral healthcare/developmental disabilities/hospitals to coordinate with the DOH to propose revisions to chapter 1.10 and 10.1 of title 23, including updates and revisions of statutory language and evidence-based best practices.

1644.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1644.title: Air Quality In Schools
1644.description: Requires the department of health, in conjunction with the department of environmental management, to conduct indoor and outdoor air quality tests in all public and private schools throughout the state on an annual basis.

1646.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1646.title: Confidentiality Of Health Care Communications And Information Act
1646.description: Requires health insurers to accommodate the request for communication in the form and format requested by the insured.

1648.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1648.title: Levy And Local Assessment Of Local Taxes
1648.description: Applys a tax to moderate-income housing equal to eight percent (8%) of the property's previous year's gross scheduled rental income as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development Handbook 4461.1, Chapter 4, Section 2.

1650.title: Rhode Island Sanctuary State Act
1650.description: Designates schools, places of worship and courts as sensitive locations and require judicial warrant be obtained before enforcement of immigration laws. Prohibits local law enforcement enforcing federal immigration laws or providing personal information.

1652.title: Motor Vehicle Violations Fines Collected
1652.description: Prohibits the state, municipalities, or courts from attempting to collect any motor vehicle violation fines or costs, after more than seven (7) years of the fine becoming final.

1660.title: Mechanics' Liens
1660.description: Provides for the release of unperfected mechanics' liens by the filing of an affidavit.

1663.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1663.title: Zoning And Planning Boards
1663.description: Amend the voting requirements of planning and zoning boards.

1665.title: Relating To Criminals-correctional Institutions-privately Owned And Operated Detention Facilities
1665.description: Prohibits the operation of privately run detention facilities. Those currently in operation may continue to do so until January 1, 2028.

1668.title: Procedure In Particular Actions--joint And Several Liability
1668.description: Limit liability of a tortfeasor for damages to several only and not joint, if it is found that the defendant’s act or omission caused no more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the damages sustained by the plaintiff.

1669.title: Surety Bond For Tax Credits
1669.description: Requires an individual seeking a tax credit on property with a value greater than five million dollars must submit affidavit stating there are no outstanding liens.

1672.title: Procedure Generally - Nondisclosure Agreements
1672.description: Places limits on the terms that can be included in an agreement that settles a claim of sexual harassment, retaliation for reporting sexual harassment and stalking.

1674.title: Hospital-workplace Violence Protection Act
1674.description: Establishes procedures for employees to file complaints with hospital or director of department of health, for assaultive behavior or other violation of law occurring on hospital grounds and require hospitals to institute safety training for employees.

1675.title: Procedure Generally
1675.description: Reduce the statutory interest on judgments for money in civil actions from twelve percent (12%) to six percent (6%).

1676.title: Preventing Discrimination On The Basis Of Race
1676.description: Protects hairstyle discrimination by expanding the definition of race to include traits historically associated with the race, including but not limited to, hair texture and protective hairstyles.

1677.title: Nondisclosure Agreement
1677.description: Definef nondisclosure agreement and identifies mandatory and permissible nondisclosure agreements' language.

1680.title: Public Safety And Peer Support Members
1680.description: Requires emergency service providers providing counseling to other providers to be certified by the International Critical Incident Stress Foundation, Inc. and requires the counselors to keep privileged the information received, with several exceptions.

1681.title: Arrest
1681.description: Adds Rhode Island certified state constables to the definition of peace officer.

1689.title: Fair Employment Practices -- Sexual Harassment
1689.description: Extends protection to persons employed in domestic service and include retaliation as an unlawful employment practice.

1692.title: Labor And Payment Of Debts By Contractors
1692.description: Requires bidders for any school construction contract of $5,000,000 or more to have apprenticeship programs. Effective July 1, 2021.

1694.title: Mechanical Trades
1694.description: Allows the holder of a valid master mechanical trade license to perform repair or renovation work on certain large air conditioning equipment but must subcontract the work if it includes new construction.

1695.title: Apprenticeships
1695.description: Comprehensively amend the state’s apprenticeship statutes to make them more consistent with applicable federal regulations and to make them easier to understand and more consistent with each other.

1696.title: Rhode Island Parental And Family Medical Leave Act
1696.description: Increases the amount of parental or family leave available to an employee from thirteen (13) weeks to twenty-six (26) weeks in any two (2) calendar years.

1734.title: Credit For Reinsurance Act
1734.description: Incorporate provisions of the National Association of Insurance Commissioner standards into chapter 1.1 of title 27, the "credit for reinsurance act".

1738.title: Educational Services To Very Young Children
1738.description: Develops and implements strategies to improve the compensation of early educators so programs can attract, develop, and retain effective staff to care for and educate young children and provide family-focuses services.

1739.title: Rhode Island School-to-career Transition Act Of 1996
1739.description: Implements an individual career and academic plan graduation requirement for each student enrolled in public schools in the sixth through twelfth grade, starting with students entering the sixth grade in the 2023-2024 school year.

1740.title: Education Accoutability Act
1740.description: Requires that the board of education incorporate additional questions into its annual assessment of schools and related surveys and provide annual reports to the house of representatives and the senate.

1747.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1747.title: Relating To Waters And Navigation
1747.description: Creates the Rhode Island Water Authority as a quasi-public corporation.

1764.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1764.title: Consent To Medical And Surgical Care
1764.description: Prohibits a pelvic, rectal, or breast examination on an unconscious or anesthetized patient unless the patient gives informed consent, the exam is within the scope of care or the examination is required for diagnostic purposes.

1765.title: Individual Health Insurance Coverage
1765.description: Requires individual health insurers, large group health insurers and small employer health insurers to provide coverage for ten (10) categories of essential health benefits listed in the act.

1774.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
1774.title: Councils And Governing Bodies
1774.description: Requires the city or town council or local licensing authority to provide notice to all licensed businesses within five hundred feet (500’) of the proposed location of the new business license to be heard

1775.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1775.title: Zoning Ordinances-neighborhood
1775.description: Amends several sections of the Rhode Island Zoning Enabling Act of 1991 with the intent of preserving neighborhood character and promoting smart growth.

1781.title: Statewide Referenda Elections
1781.description: Amends certain election statutes to require ballot questions be written in plain language.

1782.title: Claim Adjusters
1782.description: Exempts a person from examination who hold a national or state-base claims certification that requires a minimum of 40 hours pre-exam casework, a competency examination and 24 hours of continuing education required for certification renewals.

1784.title: Procedure Generally - Writs, Summons And Process
1784.description: Provides for minimum qualifications for court constable to include education, military, or law enforcement experience and drug and psychological screening.

1789.title: Inheritance From Child By Non-supporting Parent
1789.description: Authorizes the probate court to deny a parent of a child who dies intestate from inheriting a share of the decedent's estate if that parent did not contribute to the child's support.

1800.title: Implantation Devices As Conditions Of Employment
1800.description: Prohibit an employer from subjecting its employees or prospective employees to the implantation of an implantation device. It would create criminal penalties as well as civil damages, that may be assessed against violating employers.

1803.title: Procedure In Particular Actions
1803.description: Increases the maximum amount to be recovered in civil court action as a small claims from two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500) to seven thousand dollars ($7,000).

1805.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Regulatory
1805.description: Expands the availability of public funds to candidates for the general assembly while also increasing the maximum amount of funds available for general office candidates.

1806.title: Special License For Motorcycles, Motor Scooters, And Other Motor Driven Cycles -- Helmets
1806.description: Requires all motorcycle operators to wear a helmet of a type approved by the administrator of the division of motor vehicles.

1807.title: Apprenticeship Pathways To Earning A Bachelor's Degree Act
1807.description: Creates the Apprenticeship Pathways to Earning a Bachelor’s Degree Act, to enable an individual to earn a bachelor’s degree at public higher education instructions throughout the state by earning credits through apprenticeships.

1809.title: Establishing The "commuter Transportation Benefits Act"
1809.description: Establish the commuter transportation benefit act. Employers with five hundred (500) or more employees would provide a pre-tax transportation fringe benefit program or provide transportation to the employees.

1810.title: Freedom To Travel And Work Act
1810.description: Establishes an occupational regulatory framework by authorizing the issuance of occupational licenses and government certifications by recognition for qualified worker applicants from other states.

1815.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1815.title: Public Buildings
1815.description: This act allows the secretary of state to commission portraits of senate president upon leaving office and would require that the portraits be paid for by the joint committee on legislative services.

1816.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1816.title: Rhode Island Military And Veterans Affairs Oversight Commission
1816.description: Creates the Rhode Island military and veterans affairs oversight commission to oversee all operations of the Rhode Island office of veterans affairs.

1824.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Gender-based Price Discrimination
1824.description: Bans gender-based price discrimination on hygiene products by retail establishments with a fine of up to five hundred dollars ($500) for a first violation and one thousand dollars ($1,000) for each subsequent violation.

1830.title: Relating To Public Notice In The Town Of Burrillville
1830.description: Relating To Public Notice In The Town Of Burrillville

1831.title: Employment Of Persons With Disabilities On State Contracts
1831.description: Requires any company that is issued a contract for services in the state of Rhode Island, or any political subdivision therein, to employ a certain percentage of individuals with disabilities.

1834.title: Statewide Referendum
1834.description: Provides for $1,000,000 in bonds to improve local roadways, pedestrian spaces, bikeway paths and municipal parks.

1837.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1837.title: Department Of Health -- Adult Day Care Program Licensure
1837.description: Prevents promulgating any regulation discriminating against/giving preference to the number/percentage of participants receiving adult day care services based upon their age/age group.

1838.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1838.title: Nursing Home Staffing
1838.description: Mandates minimum staffing levels and standards for quality care for nursing homes and their residents.

1841.title: Yearly Inspections Of Healthcare Facilities
1841.description: Requires healthcare facilities that perform abortions to meet the license requirements of similar healthcare facilities.

1846.title: Asset Forfeiture
1846.description: Creates a new chapter to standardize procedures for asset forfeitures for all crimes.

1851.title: Healthy And Safe Families And Workplaces Act
1851.description: Allows construction employees with multi-employer bargaining agreements to be governed by agreement language for sick time/safe leave benefits and administered by ERISA trust fund.

1852.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1852.title: Lending Or Borrowing Money Or Receipt Of Credit By Licensees
1852.description: Prohibits the lending or borrowing of money or receipt of credit by delinquent licensees among manufacturers, wholesalers and retailers of alcoholic beverages as regulated by the department of business regulation (DBR).

1857.title: - Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes
1857.description: - Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes

1861.title: Regional Vocational Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
1861.description: Seeks to advance economic development by guaranteeing students the right to enroll in approved career technical educational programs and would allow them to enroll outside the district of residence if their district does not offer a duplicate program.

1863.title: Curriculum [see Title 19 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
1863.description: Provides for a minimum standard for the public education system.

1876.title: Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation
1876.description: Provides that any operational surplus of the Rhode Island resource recovery corporation shall be automatically transferred, on an annual basis, to a restricted receipt account for the sole purpose of waste management infrastructure.

1878.title: Municipal Incentive Aid
1878.description: Authorizes the general treasurer to withhold state aid to municipalities which do not meet certain requirements regarding locally-administered pension plans and, if applicable, funding improvement plans.

1884.title: Historic Residence - Tax Credit
1884.description: Amends the definition of "Commission" to include the Cumberland local historic district commission.

1886.title: Retirement Of State And Municipal Employees
1886.description: Allows retired municipal and state employees to reenter the system for up to twenty hours per week without interrupting their pension benefits.

1892.title: Historical Area Zoning
1892.description: Authorizes the town of Cumberland to establish by ordinance a list of buildings and structures with historic and architectural value and require a delay of any demolition for further evaluation.

1893.title: Insurers' Rehabilitation And Liquidation Act -- Insurance Receivership Model Act
1893.description: Adopts a portion of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) model act with respect to receiverships, specifically with regards to how derivative contracts are treated in cases of insurance receiverships.

1895.title: Probation And Parole Support
1895.description: Repeals court costs against all defendants who plead nolo contendere, guilty or are found guilty of a crime.

1896.title: Costs
1896.description: Provides that a defendant's qualification for the services of public defender constitutes prima facie evidence of indigency and limited ability to pay court costs and no costs shall be ordered unless procedures for determining ability to pay are followed.

1901.title: The Rhode Island Unborn Child Protection From Dismemberment Abortion Act
1901.description: Prohibits dismemberment abortions unless there is serious health risk to the unborn child's mother.

1907.title: Jails And Prisons
1907.description: Credits those people detained in the adult correctional institution the amount of one hundred fifty dollars ($150) per day toward any fines or costs they owe to the court when held for lack of bail for failure to appear for a costs review hearing.

1909.title: Temporary Disability Insurance Benefits
1909.description: Increases temporary caregiver benefits to six weeks starting January 1, 2021 and then to eight weeks starting January 1, 2022.

1910.title: Payment Of Wages -- Violations
1910.description: Increases penalties for violations of certain wage and hour laws.

1915.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Health and Human Services
1915.title: Registration Of Nursing Assistants
1915.description: Allows for a nurse to delegate tasks to certified nursing assistants and authorizes the department of health to promulgate regulations that delineate delegable tasks.

1934.title: The Elder Adult Financial Exploitation Prevention Act
1934.description: Requires employees of regulated financial institutions to report suspected financial exploitation of elder adults to the office of healthy aging and provide authority to the regulated financial institution to place a temporary hold on transactions.

1945.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Acme Auto Leasing, Llc

1946.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Jbtg, Llc
1946.description: Re-instates the charter of a domestic limited liability company.
